helptopic.text: Event moderation can be enabled for an entire calendar by editing that calendar's settings. This permission allows you to make an exception for a specific usergroup.

helptopic.title: Modifying Calendar Permissions
helptopic.text: From here you can set custom permissions for any usergroup for a specific calendar. For each calendar you have, each usergroup is listed. If the name of the group is red, they already have custom permissions set. If the name is white, they are using default permissions. To change permissions, click Edit next to the group name you wish to change, under the calendar you wish it to apply to.

helptopic.title: About Scheduled Tasks
helptopic.text:
Related General Help Topics:
Scheduled Tasks
Scheduled Tasks Log

Scheduled Tasks:
vBulletin's scheduled tasks system is used to perform regularly needed tasks at certain time intervals. Scheduled tasks are basically vBulletin cron jobs.

One benefit of the scheduled tasks system is that common vBulletin tasks, like updating view counters and sending emails, can be queued up and performed all at once which reduces the average server load. This can make a huge difference on high traffic forums. You can choose to schedule common vBulletin tasks in your vBulletin options.

helptopic.title: Adding a Scheduled Task
helptopic.text: On this screen you add a new scheduled task.

helptopic.title: Active
helptopic.text: If this is set to No, the script will no longer be executed automatically though it will still be possible to use the Run Now button if required.

helptopic.title: Description
helptopic.text: This is the description of the scheduled task. It is only used for your information in the control panel, and can be anything you wish.

helptopic.title: Varname
helptopic.text: This is a short name for the task and is only used internally. It may only contain letters, numerals and the underscore character and must start with a letter.

helptopic.title: Log Phrase
helptopic.text: The log phrase allows you to phrase the entries that appear in the admin log. You need to call log_cron_action() with a 1 for the third parameter to invoke the phrase in the log viewer. Otherwise the value saved in the description field will be displayed as is. You may also save the description field in serialized form if you have more than one replacement in your phrase.

helptopic.title: Title
helptopic.text: This is the title of the scheduled task. It is only used for your information in the control panel, and can be anything you wish.

helptopic.title: Day of the Week
helptopic.text: This is the day of the week the task should run on. Set this to * to have it not apply, or for it to run every day (if Day of the Month is set to * below). Otherwise select a specific day. Note that this will override the day of the month option, unless this is set to *.

helptopic.title: Day of the Month
helptopic.text: Set this to the specific day of the month the task should run. This is overridden by the Day of the Week setting above. Set this to * to have it not apply.

helptopic.title: Hour
helptopic.text: This is the hour of the day the task should run. Set it to * to have it run every hour.

helptopic.title: Minute
helptopic.text: This is the minute of the hour the task should run. Set it to * to have it run every minute (not really recommended!).

helptopic.title: Log Actions
helptopic.text: If this is set to Yes, every time the scheduled task runs, a log will be made indicating that the task was run, and in certain cases, additional information will be provided (e.g. for the Birthday Email task, the usernames who were sent birthday wishes will be noted).

helptopic.title: Filename
helptopic.text:
This is the most crucial setting. Enter the path to, and filename of, the file to be run. This is in relation to your main forums directory. The default scheduled tasks are located in the directory
./includes/cron/
Note the . at the beginning - this indicates that the following is an absolute path from the current directory, not from the root of the server (as /includes/cron would indicate). You could also write the above as
includes/cron
The file to be run should not echo anything or send output to screen.

helptopic.title: Editing Scheduled Tasks
helptopic.text: On this screen you edit an existing scheduled task.

helptopic.title: Product
helptopic.text: This controls what product this task is associated with. You do not need to worry about this option unless you are planning on making an addon for vBulletin to be released.

helptopic.title: Scheduled Tasks
helptopic.text:
This screen provides an overview of your scheduled tasks, including when they run, their next run time, and an option to run them right now.

The columns across the top are:
m: (Minute) This is the minute that a task runs. If this is an asterisk it runs every minute.
h: (Hour) This is the hour of the day that a task runs. If this is an asterisk it runs every hour.
D: (Date) This is the day of the month (numerically) that a task runs. If this is an asterisk it runs every day.
M: (Month) This is the month of the year that a task runs. If this is an asterisk it runs every month.
DoW: (Day of Week) This is the day of the week that a task runs. If this is an asterisk, it defers to the Day setting.
Title: This is the title of the task.
Next Time: This is the next time the task is scheduled to run. You can run it immediately using the Run Now button at the far right.
Controls: This column contains a drop-down with Edit and Delete controls, and a Run Now button to run the task immediately.

At the bottom of the screen you can use the Add New Scheduled Task button to add a task.

helptopic.title: Delete Scheduled Task
helptopic.text: This is a confirmation that you want to delete this scheduled task. Click the "Yes" button to perform the deletion.

helptopic.title: About Scheduled Task Log
helptopic.text:
Related General Help Topics:
Statistics
Control Panel Log
Moderator Log
Scheduled Task Log

Scheduled Task Log:
The scheduled task log contains log entries for every scheduled task that has been run since you last pruned the log. This log is useful in confirming that your scheduled tasks are running at their proper times. Log files can also be useful sources of information when you are tracking down a problem.

helptopic.title: Viewing/Pruning the Scheduled Task Log
helptopic.text: On this screen you select the options to view or prune your Scheduled Task Log. A log entry is generated every time a Scheduled Task runs that has been set to be logged. Options are described below.

helptopic.title: Viewing: Log entries to display per page
helptopic.text: This determines how many log entries are displayed on each results page. Do not set this too high or your browser could crash.

helptopic.title: Viewing & Pruning
helptopic.text:
Viewing: Show only entries generated by...
If you wish to only view logs generated by a particular script, select it from the list here.

Pruning: Remove Entries Related to Action
If you wish to only prune entries related to a certain script, select it from this list.

helptopic.title: Viewing: Order Log Entries By
helptopic.text: Select how you wish to order your results. Choices are Date and Action.

helptopic.title: Pruning: Remove Entries Older than Days
helptopic.text: Select how many days old log entries must be before they will be deleted and enter that number here. The default is 30.

helptopic.title: Pruning Scheduled Task Logs
helptopic.text:
On this screen you are prompted to confirm your choice to prune the Scheduled Task logs. The total number of entries that will be deleted is shown.

If no entries match your pruning criteria, you will be shown an error message.

helptopic.title: Viewing Scheduled Task Log Search Results
helptopic.text:
On this screen you are shown the results of your search of the Scheduled Task Log. At the top you are told the page you are on, the total number of pages of results, and the total number of results.

The Result column displays extended information about each entry, if available.

helptopic.title: About Common Templates, StyleVars, and CSS
helptopic.text:
Related General Help Topics:
Styles & Templates
Common Templates, StyleVars, and CSS
Replacement Variables

Common Templates:
The header, headinclude, and footer templates are considered common templates because they are included / parsed on every forum page.

The header, headinclude, and footer templates are respectively represented in the templates by the $header, $headinclude, and $footer variables. The parsed contents of these three templates are substituted in for these variables when a forum page is loaded.

The header template contains the HTML code that makes up the top portion of your forum layout, including the title image and opening table code for the content table in which your forum content is displayed.

The contents of the headinclude template are inserted within the <head></head> tags on each forum page. Meta tags, style sheets, scripts, etc are added here.

The footer template contains the HTML code that makes up the bottom portion of your forum layout, including the closing table tags for the content table in which your forum content is displayed and the vBulletin copyright notice.

StyleVars:
The StyleVars on this page include the "Size and Dimensions", "Image Paths", and "Miscellaneous" tables below. These settings control various style related aspects of your forum pages. These stylevars are represented in the templates as:

$stylevar[var_name]

These stylevar variables are parsed into their corresponding values when a forum page is loaded. By representing commonly used stylevars as variables in the templates it is very easy to change them - just edit their values on this page and the changes will take effect for all forum pages.

CSS:
vBulletin uses CSS classes for its various page elements. These page elements all call on the various CSS classes defined here. Therefore, you can change the attributes of all page elements that use a CSS class by editing the class on this page. A good site to learn CSS is w3.org.

Note that several CSS attributes are color fields which use standard HTML color codes. You can click on the color box to the right to pull up the color picker window where you can visually pick a color by clicking on it. vBulletin will automatically insert the corresponding color code for the color you pick. The small button to the left of the close box allows you to switch color palettes for more choices. The dotted box on the top left represents no color (transparent).

helptopic.title: Editing the Images, Fonts and other Style Options
helptopic.text: On this screen you can edit a large number of style options relating to your forums display. Each style can have its' own set of CSS and images by customizing the items on this screen.

helptopic.title: Header
helptopic.text: The header template contains the HTML code that makes up the top portion of your forum layout, including the title image and opening table code for the content table.

helptopic.title: Headinclude
helptopic.text: The contents of the headinclude template are inserted within the <head></head> tags on each forum page. Meta tags, style sheets, scripts, etc are added here.

helptopic.title: Footer
helptopic.text: The footer template contains the HTML code that makes up the bottom of your forum layout, including the closing tags for the content table and everything below it.

helptopic.title: Main Table Width
helptopic.text:
Specify a pixel size or percentage.

For example, if you want your forum content to always fill the entire browser window regardless of window size / screen resolution then you would set this to 100%. On the other hand, if you want your forum content to exist within a fixed box then you would enter a pixel value here... for example, 800 or a little less is optimal for 800x600 resolution.

helptopic.title: Spacer Size
helptopic.text: On your forumhome page, for example, you will notice there is a gap between the boxes that contain your forums and the outside border of your forum layout. This setting controls how large that gap is.

helptopic.title: Outer Border Width
helptopic.text:
This is the width of the main border that contains all tables on a page. This setting is not used in vB3 unless it was imported from a vB2 template.

An example of a table cell is one of the boxes on your forumhome page that contains a linked forum name and its description.

helptopic.title: Inner Border Width
helptopic.text:
This is the cellspacing attribute of your forum tables. The larger this number, the farther apart vBulletin's table cells will be from eachother.

An example of a table cell is one of the boxes on your forumhome page that contains a linked forum name and its description.

helptopic.title: Table Cell Padding
helptopic.text:
This is the cellpadding attribute of your forum tables. This setting determines how big a table cell is around its content.

An example of a table cell is one of the boxes on your forumhome page that contains a linked forum name and its description.

helptopic.title: Form Element Spacer Size
helptopic.text: This setting controls the spacing of different elements in a form. A good example of a form with lots of elements that can be spaced is the form in the "Additional Options" table on new thread / reply posting pages.

helptopic.title: Form Width
helptopic.text:
This setting controls the width of most of vBulletin's forms. Examples of forms that are affected by this setting include poll voting forms and the form in the "Additional Options" table on posting pages.

Enter a number of pixels followed by a "px" (e.g., 640px).

helptopic.title: User Control Panel Form Width
helptopic.text:
This setting allows you to set the width of forms in the User CP. A good example of a page with forms which this setting affects is the Edit Profile page.

Enter a number of pixels followed by a "px" (e.g., 480px).

helptopic.title: Message Area Width
helptopic.text:
This setting allows you to set the width of the text box used for all message posting in vBulletin. An example of such a text box is on the new thread / reply posting pages.

Enter a number of pixels followed by a "px" (e.g., 540px).

helptopic.title: User Control Panel Message Area Width
helptopic.text:
This setting allows you to set the width of the message area in user control panel. The Send New Private Message form, for example (if you have the PM feature enabled).

Enter a number of pixels followed by a "px" (e.g., 380px).

helptopic.title: Code Block Width
helptopic.text:
This setting allows you to set the width of code blocks in messages. This should be set to a width that will not stretch your forum layout. To see an example of a code block you can post a new thread on your forums and put this in the message: [code]test[/code].

Enter a number of pixels followed by a "px" (e.g., 640px).

helptopic.title: Title Image
helptopic.text:
Enter a file name complete with a path that is relative to your forum directory.

For example, if your title image is named titleimage.gif and you upload it to the images directory in your forum directory, then you would enter this: images/titleimage.gif

helptopic.title: Button Images Folder
helptopic.text:
The button images folder contains images like the "New Thread" and "Post Reply" images. Because these images contain language-specific text you can override this setting in the language manager.

Enter a directory path that is relative to your forum directory (e.g., images/buttons).

helptopic.title: Item Status Icon Folder
helptopic.text:
This folder contains all the icons representing the status of forums, threads, posts etc.

Enter a directory path that is relative to your forum directory (e.g., images/statusicon).

helptopic.title: Attachment Icons Folder
helptopic.text:
Attachment icons are used to identify different types of attached files. The names of these images use the file type they are representing. For example, the image for zip files is named zip.gif and is uploaded to the attachment icon folder.

Enter a directory path that is relative to your forum directory (e.g., images/attach).

helptopic.title: Miscellaneous Images Folder
helptopic.text:
The miscellaneous images folder contains miscellaneous images. Examples include the instant messenger icons and the vb_bullet.gif icon.

Enter a directory path that is relative to your forum directory (e.g., images/misc).

helptopic.title: Text Editor Controls Folder
helptopic.text:
The text editor controls folder contains the small shortcut images used in the vBulletin text editors (like the WYSIWYG text editor).

Enter a directory path that is relative to your forum directory (e.g., images/editor).

helptopic.title: Poll Images Folder
helptopic.text:
The poll images folder contains the images that are used to build the colored bars in poll results.

Enter a directory path that is relative to your forum directory (e.g., images/polls).

helptopic.title: Ratings Images Folder
helptopic.text:
The ratings images folder contains the star images used for thread ratings.

Enter a directory path that is relative to your forum directory (e.g., images/rating).

helptopic.title: HTML Doctype
helptopic.text:
The <!DOCTYPE> declaration is the very first thing in your document, before the <html> tag. This tag tells the browser which HTML or XHTML specification the document uses.

At this time, vBulletin 3 defaults to the XHTML Transitional DTD of:

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">

helptopic.title: Reputation Images Folder
helptopic.text:
The reputation images folder contains the little colored dot images that are used to display a user's reputation.

Enter a directory path that is relative to your forum directory (e.g., images/reputation).

helptopic.title: Google AdSense
helptopic.text:
vBulletin offers two different Google AdSense packages. Each package will implement a different set of advertising units into the forum advertising templates. You may also control the type of ad that is delivered in each unit.

Type of Ads to Show

With this option, you may control the type of ads delivered by Google AdSense.

  • Text ads only: AdSense will only show ads consisting of text and links.
  • Text and image ads: AdSense will only show advertistments that contain images if possible but fall back to text-only ads if necessary. This is the recommended option.

No Google AdSense Ads

This option will remove all Google AdSense code from the vBulletin forum advertising templates.

Low Package Ad Units

The Low package adds two small advertising units to the main forum pages:

  • Below the header navigation bar: Horizontal link unit with 5 contextual links to related advertising. This unit is always text. Ad unit color same as background.
  • Below the page content, above the footer: Small, horizontal advertising block. Ad unit color same as background.

High Package Ad Units

  • Below the header navigation bar: Medium, horizontal advertisting block. Ad unit color contrasts with background.
  • Below the page content, above the footer: Medium, horizontal text advertising block. Ad unit color same as background.
  • First post, right hand side of content: Only visible for guests (or registered members who haven't logged in). Nearly-square advertising block.

Further Information from Google

For more information about the individual advertising units, or any other aspects of the Google AdSense product, please visit the following URL:
https://www.google.com/adsense/support/

vBulletin Solutions, Inc. cannot be held responsible for the content of external sites.

helptopic.title: About Diagnostics
helptopic.text:
Related General Help Topics:
Database Backup
Repair / Optimize
Update Counters
Diagnostics
Execute SQL Query

Diagnostics:
The diagnostics page contains several diagnostics that are useful for troubleshooting problems with your forums.

The "Upload" diagnostic tests file uploading functionality on your server. If your server isn't configured correctly for file uploads then several vBulletin features will not work including custom avatar uploads and post attachments.

The "Email" diagnostic will send a test email to the address you specify. If you receive the test email then PHP and your mail server are configured correctly. Otherwise they are not configured correctly and you need to contact your host. Without email functionality you will not be able to use any email features on your forums including email verification on registration and "send to friend."

The "Suspect File Versions" diagnostic checks the version of every PHP file in your forum directory and tells you which ones are for different versions of vBulletin than the one you are running. Running files that are not meant for your version of vBulletin can cause any number of problems. If any files are for different versions then you should upload the originals from the vBulletin zip file for the version you are running.

The "System Information" diagnostics report on your MySQL configuration and the status of your database. vBulletin team members may ask you to give them the output of these reports to help them troubleshoot problems with your server and forums.

helptopic.title: Email Settings Test
helptopic.text: This is the results of your Email Settings test. If any errors occurred during the test, they will be listed, along with the values of several pertinent settings.

helptopic.title: System Information Results
helptopic.text:
On this screen you are shown the results of your system information inquiry.

The various types of information you can be shown is described below:
MySQL Variables is a list of the MySQL variables that are set. Please visit the following pages for more information on MySQL variables and their meanings: MySQL Variables, Tuning Server Parameters.
MySQL Status shows the status of many things related to the MySQL server. For more information on the items listed on this page, visit MySQL Status.
Table Status: If you are running MySQL 3.23 or higher, you can also view this page of information. The following link provides more information about the information displayed on this page: MySQL Table Status.

helptopic.title: Upload Settings Results
helptopic.text:
On this screen you are shown the results of the Upload Settings test. The relevant PHP settings are listed, and if there are any errors they will be listed.

For more information on the various PHP settings, please visit the following links:
file_uploads
open_basedir
safe_mode
upload_tmp_dir
upload_max_filesize

helptopic.title: Suspect File Versions
helptopic.text: All files listed below are suspected to be for different versions of vBulletin than the version you are running. You should overwrite the files listed below with the original files from the vBulletin zip file for your version.

helptopic.title: Running Diagnostic Tests
helptopic.text: On this page you can run several diagnostics to try and troubleshoot file uploading and email distribution. Additionally you can view three different sets of system information. More information is available below.

helptopic.title: Filename
helptopic.text: For this test, you need to select a file to upload to the server. This file will be removed immediately after the test is completed and it will not be stored on the server for more than about 1/2 second. After you select a file, press the Submit button to run the test.

helptopic.title: Email
helptopic.text: In this test, you must enter a valid email address to send a test email to. After you do so and click Submit, vBulletin will attempt to email the address and will show the results, noting errors, if any, that occurred.

helptopic.title: View...
helptopic.text: For this section, select from one of three sets of information to view: Table Status (if you are running MySQL 3.23 or higher), MySQL Status, and MySQL Variables. (see System Information Results)

helptopic.title: Test Communication
helptopic.text: This page tests your active payment processors to make sure they are working with the parameters you have set in the Payment API Manager. If anything below fails, then that means the corresponding payment processor is not currently working with your forum - that means you either set the wrong parameters for that processor or something is wrong with the processor itself.

helptopic.title: About Emailing Users
helptopic.text:
Related General Help Topics:
Users
User Tools
User Banning
Emailing Users
Access Masks

Emailing Users:
The email pages in the Users tab of the Admin CP allow you to send mass emails and generate mailing lists based on the same search criteria you use to search for users on the Search for Users page.

You can email users on the Send Email to Users page and you can generate a mailing list of email addresses on the Generate Mailing List page. Both pages use the same search criteria. vBulletin emails / includes in the mailing list only users whose profiles match the search criteria you specify. One obvious application of these email features is to send out mass emails notifying your members of updates to your forums. Other applications include sending warning emails to inactive users before you prune their accounts or otherwise deal with them.

helptopic.title: Generating a List of User Emails
helptopic.text:
From here, you select criteria to produce a list of user email addresses. This list can then be used in another program, such as Outlook, to email your users. The criteria are described below.

Keep in mind all criteria are cumulative; that is, if you enter a username string to match and select a usergroup, users that match the username string AND are in the selected group will be found, but those that match only one of the above will not.

helptopic.title: Text To Separate Addresses By
helptopic.text: Enter the character or text that addresses should be separated by. What this needs to be is dependant on what program you will be feeding these addresses to. This is a space by default, but you may wish to produce, for example, CSV (in this case use a comma) or quoted CSV (use: "," in this case, including the quotes). In most email programs, a comma or semi-colon followed by a space is needed. Your needs may differ, however. To make each address be on a new line, press Enter in the text box.

helptopic.title: User Name Contains
helptopic.text:
The usernames of those who will be emailed must contain the phrase entered in this box. By "phrase", we mean a string of characters. They do not have to make a word but they must be exactly how they appear in the user(s) name(s).

For example, the string exam would match example, anexample, and theexam, but not exsiam.

helptopic.title: Usergroup Is
helptopic.text: Users must be in the specified group to be emailed if you select a usergroup here.

helptopic.title: Also Belongs to Usergroups
helptopic.text:
If the users to be emailed should belong to any other usergroups, check them off here.

Users must belong to all groups that are selected!

helptopic.title: Include users that have declined admin emails?
helptopic.text: Enabling this option will send emails to users who have chosen not to receive emails.

helptopic.title: Email Contains
helptopic.text: The user's email address must contain the string entered here. See Username Contains for information on the string matching used here.

helptopic.title: Parent's Email Contains
helptopic.text: If the user(s) you are looking for are of the COPPA variety, they will have had to enter their parent's email for verification. If this is the case, enter the string to find in their parent's email address here. See Username Contains for information on the string matching used here.

helptopic.title: Is COPPA User
helptopic.text: If this is set to Yes, the user(s) found will all be COPPA users; that is, under 13. Set this to No to not find COPPA users, or leave it blank to find both.

helptopic.title: Homepage Contains
helptopic.text: Enter the string that the user's homepage must contain. Users without a homepage URL entered will be automatically excluded from the results of this search. See Username Contains for information on the string matching used here.

helptopic.title: ICQ Number Contains
helptopic.text: Since ICQ Numbers naturally contain only numbers, you must enter a string of number(s) here. Users without an ICQ number entered will be automatically excluded from the results of this search. See Username Contains for information on the string matching used here.

helptopic.title: AIM Handle Contains
helptopic.text: Enter the string of characters the user's AIM handle, or screen name, must contain. Users without an AIM screen name are automatically excluded from the results of this search. See Username Contains for information on the string matching used here.

helptopic.title: Yahoo Messenger Handle Contains
helptopic.text: Enter the string that the user's Yahoo Messenger Handle must contain. Users without a Yahoo Messenger Handle entered will be automatically excluded from the results of this search. See Username Contains for more information on the string matching used here.

helptopic.title: MSN ID
helptopic.text: Enter the string that the user's MSN ID must contain. Users without an MSN ID entered will be automatically excluded from the results of this search. See Username Contains for more information on the string matching used here.

helptopic.title: Skype Name
helptopic.text: Enter the string that the user's Skype name must contain. Users without a Skype name entered will be automatically excluded from the results of this search. See Username Contains for more information on the string matching used here.

helptopic.title: Signature Contains
helptopic.text: Enter the string that the user's signature must contain. Users without a signature will be automatically excluded from the results of this search. See Username Contains for more information on the string matching used here.

helptopic.title: User Title Contains
helptopic.text: Enter the text that the user's title must contain. This is applicable even if you don't allow custom user titles, since the user title of every user is stored with their username, so default group titles would be searched as well. See Username Contains for more information on the string matching used here.

helptopic.title: Join Date is After
helptopic.text: Enter the date the user must have joined after to be found. The format is yyyy-mm-dd; for example, 2002-08-30. This can work in conjunction with the Join Date is Before criteria to create a finite range of join dates. Keep in mind that if you use them together, that this date must be BEFORE the Join Date is Before date, or no users will be found! (see Join Date is Before)

helptopic.title: Join Date is Before
helptopic.text: The user must have joined before this date to be found. The format is yyyy-mm-dd; for example, 2002-08-30. This can work in conjunction with the Join Date is After criteria to create a finite range of join dates. Keep in mind that if you use them together, this date must be AFTER the Join Date is After date, or no users will be found! (see Join Date is After)

helptopic.title: Last Activity is After
helptopic.text: The user must have loaded a forum page after this date if they are to be found. The format is yyyy-mm-dd; for example, 2002-08-30. This can work in conjunction with the "Last Activity is Before" criteria to create a range of active dates.

helptopic.title: Last Activity is Before
helptopic.text: The user must have loaded a forum page before this date if they are to be found. The format is yyyy-mm-dd; for example, 2002-08-30. This can work in conjunction with the "Last Activity is After" criteria to create a range of active dates.

helptopic.title: Last Post is After
helptopic.text: The user's most recent post must have been made after this date and time to be found. The date and time format is yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss; for example, 2002-08-30 15:02:12 would find all users who last posted after August 30, 2002 at 3:02:12 PM. This criteria can be used in conjunction with the Last Post is Before criteria to create a finite range of last post dates. Keep in mind that if you use both, this date and time must be BEFORE the Last Post is Before date and time or no users will be found! (see Last Post is Before)

helptopic.title: Last Post is Before
helptopic.text: The user's last post must be before this date and time for the user to be found. The date and time format is yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss; for example, 2002-08-30 20:22:02 would find all users who last posted before August 30, 2002 at 8:22:02 PM. This criteria can be used in conjunction with the Last Post is After criteria to create a finite range of last post dates. Keep in mind that if you do use both, this date and time must be AFTER the Last Post is After date and time or no users will be found! (see Last Post is After)

helptopic.title: Birthday is After
helptopic.text: Enter the date that the user's birthday must be after to be found. The date format is yyyy-mm-dd; for example, 2002-08-30. Users without a birthday entered will be automatically excluded from the results of this search. This criteria can be used in conjunction with the Birthday is Before criteria to create a finite range of birthday dates. Keep in mind that if you use both, this date must be BEFORE the Birthday is Before date or it will not find any users! (see Birthday is Before)

helptopic.title: Birthday is Before
helptopic.text: This is the date the user's birthday must be before to be found. The date format is yyyy-mm-dd; for example, 2002-08-30. This criteria can be used in conjunction with the Birthday is After criteria to create a finite range of birthday dates. Keep in mind that if you use them together, this date must be AFTER the Birthday is After criteria or no users will be found! (see Birthday is After)

helptopic.title: Number of Posts is Greater Than or Equal To
helptopic.text: The user must have at least this many posts to be found. This criteria can be used in conjunction with the Number of Posts is Less Than criteria. Keep in mind that if you use both, this number must be LESS than the Number of Posts is Less Than number for any users to be found! (see Number of Posts is Less Than)

helptopic.title: Number of Posts is Less Than
helptopic.text: The user must have less than this number of posts in order to be found. This criteria can be used in conjunction with the Number of Posts is Greater Than or Equal To criteria. Keep in mind that if you do use both, this number must be MORE than the Number of Posts is Greater Than number for any users to be found! (see Number of Posts is Greater Than or Equal To)

helptopic.title: Reputation is Greater Than or Equal To
helptopic.text: The user must have at least this number of reputation points in order to be found. This criteria can be used in conjunction with the Reputation is Less Than criteria to create a finite range of reputation points to be found. Keep in mind that if you do use both, this number must be LESS than the Reputation is Less Than number or no users will be found! (see Reputation is Less Than)

helptopic.title: Reputation is Less Than
helptopic.text: The user must have less than this many reputation points to be found. This criteria can be used in conjunction with the Reputation is Greater Than or Equal To criteria to create a finite range of reputation points to find. Keep in mind that if you do use both, this number must be MORE than the Reputation is Greater Than number or no users will be found! (see Reputation is Greater Than or Equal To)

helptopic.title: Warnings are greater than or equal to
helptopic.text: Enter the minimum amount of Warnings that a user has received that you wish to search for.

helptopic.title: Warnings are less than
helptopic.text: Enter the maximum amount of Warnings that a user has received that you wish to search for.

helptopic.title: Infractions are greater than or equal to
helptopic.text: Enter the minimum amount of Infractions that a user has received that you wish to search for.

helptopic.title: Infractions are less than
helptopic.text: Enter the maximum amount of Infractions that a user has received that you wish to search for.

helptopic.title: Infraction Points are greater than or equal to
helptopic.text: Enter the minimum amount of Infraction Points that a user has received that you wish to search for.

helptopic.title: Infraction Points are less than
helptopic.text: Enter the maximum amount of Infraction Points that a user has received that you wish to search for.

helptopic.title: User ID is greater than or equal to
helptopic.text: Use this option to list users with User IDs greater or equal to the value entered.

helptopic.title: User ID is less than
helptopic.text: Enter a number here in order to match users whose User ID is less than the specified value.

helptopic.title: IP Address Contains
helptopic.text: Enter a number in this field to search by IP address. It can be a full IP address (such as 24.23.120.15) or a partial (such as 24.23.120). In the case of a partial, it would match users with any number(s) for the last block.

helptopic.title: Mass Emailing Users
helptopic.text:
On this screen you select criteria to determine who your email is sent to. These criteria are described below.

Keep in mind all criteria are cumulative; that is, if you enter a username string to match and select a usergroup, users that match the username string AND are in the selected group will be found, but those that match only one of the above will not.

helptopic.title: Just a Test
helptopic.text: If this is set to Yes, no one will actually be emailed, but vBulletin will proceed as if they were, showing you who would be sent an email.

helptopic.title: Messages to Send at Once
helptopic.text: This is the number of messages to be sent in a batch. Unless you run your own server, it is recommended this is set to 100 or less. Even if you do run your own server, unless it is not very busy, you should keep this relatively low.

helptopic.title: From
helptopic.text: This is the address that the email is to be from. The email address set as the webmaster's address is pre-filled in, but you can enter any address you wish here.

helptopic.title: Subject
helptopic.text: Enter the subject line of the email here.

helptopic.title: Message
helptopic.text:
This is the message to be sent to your users. Within the message, you may use the following special words, or variables, that will be replaced with the correct information for each user when the email is sent.
$userid: This is the user's userid. Normally this won't mean much to a user, but if you are, for example, sending an email telling users what their referrer link is, you would need to include the userid like this:
www.mysite.com/myvb/index.php?referrerid=$userid
which would then give the user credit if another user follows that link and registers.
$activateid and $activatelink are only applicable if you have Email Verification turned on and the user has not verified their address yet. $activatelink is the link that the user needs to visit to activate their account. $activateid would be used if you are manually typing out that link, otherwise it is of no use.
$username: If you want to personalize the email, or remind the user what their username is, use this variable.
$email: This is the email address on file for the user. It is useful if you wish to include a line to the effect of
This email was sent to $emailaddress which was used to register an account at the vBulletin Community Forums.
Please note you can not send passwords in emails because they are now encrypted in the database. You can, if you wish, direct users to the Lost Password page which is located at
http://www.yoursite.com/yourvb/login.php?do=lostpw

helptopic.title: About FAQs
helptopic.text:
FAQs:
The vBulletin FAQ system allows you to create infinitely nestable sets of entries, or questions, and additionally allows end-users to search the FAQs. FAQs are typically a collection of Frequently Asked Questions, while vBulletin's FAQ system is something of a FAQ / Knowledge Base hybrid because of its searchability.

vBulletin ships with a number of default sets and entries that are focused on using vBulletin from the end-user's perspective. You may wish to add additional FAQs that answer questions about your specific forum configuration - forum permissions for example.

The FAQ system also supports multiple languages. Each FAQ entry can have a translation for each language in the Language Manager. When a user loads a FAQ page vBulletin will display its FAQ entries in the language in which the current logged in user is viewing your forums.

helptopic.title: Adding FAQ Entries and Sets
helptopic.text: On this screen, you add a new FAQ entry or set. The options are described below.

helptopic.title: Product
helptopic.text: This controls what product this FAQ is associated with. You do not need to worry about this option unless you are planning on making an addon for vBulletin to be released.

helptopic.title: Short Name
helptopic.text: This is a short name for the FAQ and is only used internally. It may only contain letters, numerals and the underscore character and must start with a letter.

helptopic.title: Parent FAQ Item
helptopic.text: Any entry or set in the FAQ can be the parent for another item. Set the parent of this item here.

helptopic.title: Title
helptopic.text:
This is the title of the entry or set.

For entries, it can also be thought of as the "Question", which the "Text" answers. It does not have to be unique, but should be unique to this set of entries to minimize confusion.

For sets, it should be descriptive of what kind of questions are in the set.

helptopic.title: Text
helptopic.text:
This is the "answer" to the "question" (aka Title) of the entry. It should be viewed as a template in that you must use HTML for formatting such as line breaks.
If this is a set, this is the description of the set.

helptopic.title: Display Order
helptopic.text: This determines the order in which entries for a particular set are displayed. If you use 0, this FAQ entry will not be displayed, though entries within will still be accessible if their URL is known.

helptopic.title: Languages
helptopic.text: The Title and Text options above are the "default" text for this set or entry. If you have additional languages setup on your forum, you can enter a translation for the Title and Text for each language you have installed. This is optional. If nothing is entered, the default above will be used.

helptopic.title: Delete FAQ
helptopic.text:
This page allows you to delete this FAQ. Click the "Yes" button below to perform the deletion.

Any children of this FAQ will be deleted as well. This action cannot be undone!

helptopic.title: Editing FAQ Entries and Sets
helptopic.text: This screen allows you to modify each option for the selected FAQ entry or set. Options are described below.

helptopic.title: FAQ Administration
helptopic.text:
To view the existing FAQ sets, select Modify under FAQ Sets & Entries from the left navigation bar.

You start at the top level of the FAQ. At the very top it says "FAQ" - this will expand to become a navigation bar as you drill down into the FAQ levels. Below this is a list of the top two levels of your FAQ structure. To view lower levels, click the parent of the level you wish to view. For example, under vBulletin FAQ, click User Maintenance to view all entries associated with that topic, and child sets (if any). Or, click vBulletin FAQ to view the entries associated with all three children of vBulletin FAQ.

You can edit the properties of a a set or entry from here by clicking edit across from the item name. (see Editing FAQ Entries and Sets)

You can add additional sets or sub-sets. To do so, click Add in the left nav bar, or click Add Child across from the item you wish to add an item under. (see Adding FAQ Entries and Sets)

helptopic.title: Forum Title
helptopic.text:
Related General Help Topics:
Forums
Forum Permissions
Moderators
Viewing Permissions

Forums:
There are two kinds of forums, a forum and a category. Forums can allow new threads and posts while categories cannot. Categories are used to group forums by topic. Forums of related topics are typically created as children of a parent category to group them by topic.

When adding / editing a forum there is an option called "Act as Forum". When this option is set to "Yes" the forum will act as a forum. When this option is set to "No" the forum will act as a category.

helptopic.title: Adding a Forum
helptopic.text: Options on this page are listed below.

helptopic.title: Title
helptopic.text: This is the title of the new forum. You may use HTML in this, but be aware this will also be used as the title of the page. Since HTML formatting is not valid in the title of a page, it will be shown as plain text, and will look odd.

helptopic.title: Description
helptopic.text: This description is shown under the forum name on your forums home page, and on the forums listing page (forumdisplay.php).

helptopic.title: Link to other page
helptopic.text: If you enter a URL in this box, the forum will not be a real forum. Instead it will simply be a link to the URL you enter.

helptopic.title: Display Order
helptopic.text: This determines the order in which forums are displayed anywhere they are listed. If you set this to 0, the forum will not be displayed to end-users anywhere unless the user manually types in the URL to access it.

helptopic.title: Parent Forum
helptopic.text: If you want this to be a subforum of another forum, select that forum from this list. If not, select (No One).

helptopic.title: Default View Age
helptopic.text: This determines how many days worth of threads are shown on forumdisplay. The value chosen here will be used by guests as well as forum members that leave this option set to "Forum Default" in their settings. Users can also change this temporarily by using the controls at the bottom of forumdisplay.

helptopic.title: Default Sort Field
helptopic.text:
This controls the field that threads are sorted using by default. Users may still selectively override this setting and resort using the controls at the bottom of the thread list.

Note that to select sorting by thread rating, ratings must be enabled for this forum. If they are not, the forum will be sorted by last post.

helptopic.title: Default Sort Order
helptopic.text: This controls the order that threads are shown in by default. Users may still selectively override this setting and resort using the controls at the bottom of the thread list.

helptopic.title: Show Private Forum
helptopic.text:
Select 'No' here will hide this forum from users who are not allowed to access it. Users who do have permission to access them will have to log in before they can see these forums too.

Either of the yes options will allow users to see this forum if they don't have access to it. The ability to see the forum's post count is controlled by the two yes options. If the forum is passworded, it is treated as a private forum until the user enters the valid password.

Setting this option to 'Use Default' will use the setting in Forum Display Listings Options for this forum.

helptopic.title: Email addresses to notify when there is a new post
helptopic.text: Enter the email address(es) of anyone who should be notified when a new post is made in this forum. Separate multiple addresses with a space. It is suggested that you do not enter moderators' email addresses here - you can select whether or not a moderator receives email notifications when adding that moderator.

helptopic.title: Email addresses to notify when there is a new thread
helptopic.text: Enter the email address(es) of anyone who should be notified when a new thread is made in this forum. Separate multiple addresses with a space. It is suggested that you do not enter moderators' email addresses here - you can select whether or not a moderator receives email notifications when adding that moderator. If you add a user's email address to both the "Post" and "Thread" email notifications, that person will receive two emails when a new thread is started.

helptopic.title: Moderate Posts
helptopic.text: If this option is enabled, then posts will not show up in this forum until a moderator approves them.

helptopic.title: Thread Moderation Queue
helptopic.text: Determines whether threads will require a moderator to approve them before being displayed.

helptopic.title: Attachment Queue
helptopic.text: Determines whether new attachments will require a moderator to approve them before being displayed. If you have this set to Yes and Moderator Queue set to No, until the attachment is approved the post will be displayed with a message indicating that the attachment has successfully been posted but requires moderation.

helptopic.title: Custom Style for this Forum
helptopic.text: You can select which style to use for this forum. This will override the Default forum style if selected.

helptopic.title: Override Users Custom Styles
helptopic.text: Selecting this will force the custom style you selected above to be used instead of the style a user has chosen to browse with.

helptopic.title: Prefix for Forum Status Images
helptopic.text:
Forum Status images are usually shown alongside the forum in a forum listings to indicate the read status.

This prefix must only contain alphanumerical characters, though the following are also allowed - _ / ., a folder name is also acceptable to be placed within the status icon directory.

The following images are currently in use for status icons, you will need to create images with the specified prefix to match.
  • forum_link-48.png
  • forum_new-48.png
  • forum_new_lock-48.png
  • forum_old-48.png
  • forum_old_lock-48.png

helptopic.title: Password to Access
helptopic.text: If you set a password, a user will be required to enter that password before being allowed to enter this forum. The user must have cookies turned on to enter a password-protected forum. This password will be inherited by subforums unless those subforums have Can Have Password set to No. If a user knows the password but is in a usergroup that is not allowed to access that forum, the user will not be allowed to access it.

helptopic.title: Can Have Password
helptopic.text: If you set this to Yes, moderators will be able to set a password for this forum (even if you have given them the ability to do so in general). You as the administrator can still manually set a password for this forum, but unless you do so, if this option is set to Yes, it will not be password-protected even if parent forums are.

helptopic.title: Act as Forum
helptopic.text: If you set this to No, this forum will act as a category (that is, a non-posting forum that only exists to group other forums).

helptopic.title: Is Active
helptopic.text: This is equivalent to setting Display Order to 0, in that the forum will not be displayed anywhere but can still be accessed by typing in the URL manually.

helptopic.title: Open for New Posts
helptopic.text: This allows you to create a forum that acts as an archive - no one will be allowed to post to it, but you can still move threads into it.

helptopic.title: New Posts are Indexed by Search Engine
helptopic.text: If this is set to No, posts made in this forum from this point on will not be indexed by the search engine. Such posts will not able to be searched for. This is desirable if you have a "Testing" type forum, or a forum that is chit-chat that you don't want indexed.

helptopic.title: Allow HTML Code in posts
helptopic.text: This allows users to use HTML while posting. It is strongly recommended that you DO NOT turn this on as it can severely compromise security and/or severely mess up layout if users insert malformed HTML. Even if you set this to Yes, users still cannot use certain tags, including javascript: and about:.

helptopic.title: Allow BB code in posts
helptopic.text: This will allow users to use BB code in their posts. Setting this to Yes will not allow users to use the IMG code unless the below option is set to Yes.

helptopic.title: Allow BB IMG Code in posts
helptopic.text: This allows users to display images inline on the showthread page. If you set this to No, a link to the image will be displayed instead of showing the actual image.

helptopic.title: Allow Smilies in posts
helptopic.text: Setting this to Yes will allow your users to type things such as :) and :( and have them automatically turned into the corresponding image.

helptopic.title: Allow Icons for posts
helptopic.text: Setting this to Yes will allow users to select one icon for each post. This icon is displayed next to the title (if any) of each post and is also displayed on forumdisplay next to the thread title if an icon is set for the first post in a thread.

helptopic.title: Allow Thread Ratings in this Forum
helptopic.text: Setting this to Yes will allow your users to rate threads in this forum. They can rate them either at the bottom of showthread or while replying to a thread.

helptopic.title: Count posts made in this forum towards user post counts
helptopic.text: If this is set to No, posts made in this forum will not be added to users' post counts (which are displayed on showthread).

helptopic.title: Show On Quick Navigation
helptopic.text: Enable this option to show this forum and its children on the Quick Navigation menu.

helptopic.title: Use Selected Prefix Sets
helptopic.text: Choose which prefix sets are available for use in this forum. Note that if you don't select any, the "Require Threads to have a Prefix" option will not have any effect.

helptopic.title: Require Threads to have a Prefix
helptopic.text:
If you select this option and have chosen to use one or more prefix sets, users will not be able to submit a thread without a prefix.

Note that certain situations may still allow a thread to exist in this forum without a prefix. This can happen if a thread has been moved, a thread has been imported from an RSS feed, or a moderator has manually removed the prefix.

helptopic.title: Editing a Forum's Settings
helptopic.text:
On this screen you edit an existing forum. Options and properties are described below.

If you change any of the posting options at the bottom of this page then you should rebuild your post cache to update the existing posts in this forum.

helptopic.title: Apply this password to Child Forums
helptopic.text: If you set this to Yes and change or add a password, the password will apply to all child forums of this forum. This will not have any effect if you do not change the existing password or add a new one.

helptopic.title: Modifying Forums
helptopic.text:
On the Modify Forums screen you will see a list of every forum you have, including any which are hidden from end-users. On this screen, you can set the Display Order (make sure to click Update Display Order to save your changes).

Under the Forum Controls, across from each forum title, are the following options:
Edit: Lets you modify forum settings. (see Editing Forums)

Remove: Deletes the forum, any subforums, and posts in the forum and any subforums. This action cannot be undone, so it is highly recommended that you make a backup of your database before doing this.

Add Sub-forum: This allows you to add a forum that will be a child of the forum you select this for. (see Adding Forums)

Add Moderator: Lets you add a moderator to this forum. Moderators moderate the selected forum and any subforums of that forum. (see Adding Moderators)

Add Announcement: Allows you to add an announcement to this forum. (see Adding Announcements)

Move Contents: You can quickly move all the posts from the selected forum into another forum.

Empty Forum: Selecting this will (after confirmation) remove all the threads in a forum.

In the next column is Display Order. This determines what order forums are displayed in anyplace they are shown, including in the Admin CP. Setting this to 0 for a forum will make the forum not show anywhere to the end-user, but it can still be accessed if the user types in the direct URL to the forum. Be sure to select Update Display Order if you have changed any of them.

The last dropdown shows how many moderators you already have in each forum. If you have any, they will be listed. You can modify a moderator's permissions by selecting their name from this drop-down and pressing Go.

helptopic.title: Media Author
helptopic.text: This is shown in the Artist column in iTunes.

helptopic.title: Category
helptopic.text: Category is a required field for adding your podcast to iTunes.

helptopic.title: Enable
helptopic.text: This options enables the output of iTunes specific tags. Podcasts will still work in iTunes without the information contained on this page but they can not be added to iTunes for others to find.

helptopic.title: Explicit
helptopic.text: This is used to indicate whether or not your podcast contains explicit material.

helptopic.title: Image URL
helptopic.text: This tag specifies the artwork for your podcast. iTunes prefers square .jpg or .png images that are at least 300 x 300 pixels.

helptopic.title: Keywords
helptopic.text: This tag allows users to search on text keywords within iTunes. Use commas to separate keywords.

helptopic.title: Owner Email
helptopic.text: This email address will be used to contact the owner of the podcast for communication specifically about their podcast.

helptopic.title: Owner Name
helptopic.text: This name will be used to contact the owner of the podcast for communication specifically about their podcast.

helptopic.title: Subtitle
helptopic.text: The contents of this tag are shown in the Description column in iTunes. The subtitle displays best if it is only a few words long. If this is left blank, the Summary will be used.

helptopic.title: Summary
helptopic.text: The contents of this tag are shown in a separate iTunes window that appears when the "circled i" in the Description column is clicked. It also appears on the iTunes page for your podcast. This field can be up to 4000 characters. If this field is left blank, your forum description will be used.

helptopic.title: Delete Forum
helptopic.text:
This page allows you to delete this forum. Click the "Yes" button below to perform the deletion. This action cannot be undone.

Deleting this forum will also delete all thread and posts in it as well its subforums and their threads and posts. If you want to save the threads and posts in this forum and its subforums then you should move them first.

helptopic.title: About Forum Permissions
helptopic.text:
Related General Help Topics:
Forums
Forum Permissions
Moderators
Viewing Permissions

Forum Permissions:
By default, users will have the permissions for their usergroup (see the Usergroup Manager) in each forum. However, you might not want users of a particular usergroup to have access to every forum. In that case, vBulletin allows you to create custom permissions for a specific forum for a specific usergroup. This is useful in restricting certain forums for certain usergroups.

helptopic.title: Using the Permission Duplicator
helptopic.text:
The Permission Duplicator is a quick way to copy forum permissions from one group to other(s) or from one forum to other(s).

To use the Group-Based duplicator, select the group to copy permissions from. Then, use the checkboxes to select which groups the permissions should be copied to. Select which forum(s) permissions should be copied from in the drop-down. This will include any subforums of the forum you choose. Finally, select whether the incoming permissions should overwrite existing custom permissions, and whether they should apply to forums that are currently inheriting custom permissions from a parent forum. Click Duplicate Permissions to proceed.

The Forum-Based duplicator works in a similar way. First, select the forum to copy permissions from. This will *not* include subforums. Next, select the forums that the permissions should be copied to. If you wish to overwrite existing custom permissions, select yes to Overwrite Duplicates. Overwrite Inherited set to Yes will overwrite permissions in forums that are being inherited from parents. Click Duplicate Permissions to proceed.

helptopic.title: Copy Permissions from User Group
helptopic.text: Select the user group whose permissions you want to copy. This group's forum permissions for the forum you select will be applied to the usergroups you select below.

helptopic.title: Copy Permissions to User Groups
helptopic.text: Select the usergroups that you want to receive the source usergroup's forum permissions. These usergroups will have their current forum permissions overwritten with the source usergroup's forum permissions.

helptopic.title: Only Copy Permissions from Forum
helptopic.text: Select the forum(s) from which you want to copy permissions. The permissions of the source usergroup for this forum will copied to the destination usergroups for the forum(s) selected here.

helptopic.title: Overwrite Duplicate Permissions
helptopic.text: Overwrite Duplicate Entries prevents you from overwriting any existing permissions set for a forum (that is, they're in red) for one of the usergroups you are copying to

helptopic.title: Overwrite Inherited Permissions
helptopic.text: Overwrite Inherited Entries prevents you from overwriting any inherited permissions, from a parent, set for a forum (that is, they're in orange) for one of the usergroups you are copying to

helptopic.title: Copy Permissions from Forum
helptopic.text: Select the source forum from which to copy usergroup permissions. The permissions for the usergroups for this forum will be applied to the destination forums you select below.

helptopic.title: Copy Permissions to Forums
helptopic.text: Select the forums to which you want to copy the source forum's usergroup permissions. The permissions for each usergroup for these destination forums will be set to the permissions of the usergroups of the source forum.

helptopic.title: Overwrite Duplicate Permissions
helptopic.text: Overwrite Duplicate Entries prevents you from overwriting any existing permissions set for a forum (that is, they're in red).

helptopic.title: Overwrite Inherited Permissions
helptopic.text: Overwrite Inherited Entries prevents you from overwriting any inherited permissions from a parent (that is, they're in orange).

helptopic.title: Editing Usergroup Permissions Per Forum
helptopic.text:
This screen allows you to edit the permissions of the selected usergroup for the selected forum.

If you have edited permissions for this group and forum before, you will need to select "Use Custom Settings" to make your settings save. If you attempt to change a setting before selecting Use Custom Settings, you will be reminded to do so by clicking OK. If you click cancel on the popup, the setting will change but when you attempt to save your changes they will not be saved.

Settings on this page will override a usergroup's default permissions. If there are subforums of the selected forum, these settings will be inherited by any subforums unless the subforum has custom settings explicitly set for it already.

If you want to revert the permissions for this group, select "Use Usergroup Default" and press Save Changes. If any subforums of this forum are currently inheriting these settings, they will also be reverted to the default.

helptopic.title: Can See Thumbnails
helptopic.text: If this is set to 'Yes' the user will be able to see thumbnails of attached images in threads, even if the do not have the Can Download Attachments permission.

helptopic.title: Custom Settings vs. Usergroup Default
helptopic.text:
To have any settings on this page save, you must select "Use custom permissions". If you already have custom settings and wish to set this usergroup back to default, select "Use usergroup default" and press Save Changes.
Note that if you have custom settings for this group and remove them as described above, any subforums will also be reverted if they do not have custom settings explicitly set for themselves.

helptopic.title: Can view forum?
helptopic.text: If this is set to No, the rest of the settings on this screen are unused as the user will be denied access if they try to view any page that involves this forum.

helptopic.title: Can View Thread Content
helptopic.text: This permission controls whether or not users can view posts within a thread. This permission is independent of whether or not users can view the actual thread links within a forum.

helptopic.title: Can view others' threads
helptopic.text:
If this is set to No, users will only be allowed to view threads that they started (made the first post in).
If this usergroup is "Unregistered/Not Logged In", setting this to No have the effect of not allowing them to view any threads, even if you allow unregistered users to post because unregistered users cannot be told apart, so determining if an unregistered user posted a certain thread would be impossible.

helptopic.title: Can See Deletion Notice
helptopic.text: If this is set to Yes, this group will be able to see deletion notices in this forum. Deletion notices are what is left behind after a user deletes a post or thread. Moderators will always be able to see deletion notices in forums they moderate - this setting does not affect them.

helptopic.title: Can search?
helptopic.text: If this is set to No, the user will not be allowed to search this forum, even if they can view it or perform other actions in it. It will not appear in the list of forums to search from on the search screen, and it will not be included if the user opts to search all forums.

helptopic.title: Can use 'email to friend' feature?
helptopic.text: If this is set to No, the user will not be allowed to use the Email to Friend feature (which is linked from the bottom of every thread). This setting is disregarded if you have set Email Functions to Off under general options - no one would be allowed to use Email to Friend in that case.

helptopic.title: Can download attachments
helptopic.text: If this is set to No, users will not be allowed to download post attachments from threads in this forum. The link will still appear but they will be told, after clicking on it, that they don't have permission.

helptopic.title: Can post new threads?
helptopic.text: If this is set to No, the user will not be allowed to post new threads in this forum. They may, however, post replies to existing threads unless you revoke that permission below.

helptopic.title: Can reply to own threads?
helptopic.text: If this is set to No, users will not be able to reply to threads that they are the first poster in (started the thread). If you have Can post new threads set to No above, this setting is irrelevant.

helptopic.title: Can reply to others' threads?
helptopic.text: If this is set to No, users will not be able to reply to threads that other users start.

helptopic.title: New Posts Bypass Moderation Queue?
helptopic.text: If this is set to No, when a user from this group posts in this forum, their post will be put in the moderator queue regardless of whether or not you have turned on the moderator queue for this forum.

helptopic.title: Can post attachments?
helptopic.text: If this is set to No, users will not be allowed to attach files to their posts. They will still be allowed to use the BB IMG code to show images if you have turned that on for this forum.

helptopic.title: Can Tag Own Threads
helptopic.text: When set to yes, members of the usergroup have permission to add tags to their own threads within this forum.

helptopic.title: Can Tag Others' Threads
helptopic.text: When Set to yes, members of the usergroup have permission to add tags to others' threads within this forum.

helptopic.title: Can Delete Tags on Own Threads
helptopic.text: When Set to yes, members of the usergroup have permission to delete tags from threads that they started within this forum.

helptopic.title: Can rate threads if thread rating is enabled in this forum?
helptopic.text: If this is set to No, users in this group will not be allowed to rate threads in the forum regardless of whether or not thread rating is enabled for this forum.

helptopic.title: Can edit own posts?
helptopic.text: If this is set to No, users will not be allowed to edit their own posts.

helptopic.title: Can delete own posts?
helptopic.text: If this is set to No, users will not be allowed to delete their posts. Note that if Can delete own threads below is set to No, they will not be able to delete their post if it is the first post in a thread, even if this is set to Yes.

helptopic.title: Can move own threads to other forums?
helptopic.text: If this is set to Yes, users will be able to move their own threads between forums that they have access to. It is generally recommended to leave this set at No, leaving the thread moving to your moderators or yourself.

helptopic.title: Can open / close own threads?
helptopic.text: If this is set to Yes, users will be able to close and/or reopen threads that they started. It is generally recommended to leave this set at No. The reason is if a moderator closes a thread and this is set to Yes, the user will be able to reopen that thread by themselves.

helptopic.title: Can delete own threads?
helptopic.text: If this is set to Yes, a user will be able to delete threads that he has started by deleting the first post in that thread.

helptopic.title: Can post polls?
helptopic.text: If this is set to Yes, users will be able to add a poll to new threads that they create.

helptopic.title: Can vote on polls?
helptopic.text: If this is set to Yes, users will be able to vote on polls in this forum.

helptopic.title: Modifying Forum Permissions
helptopic.text:
On this screen, all of your forums are listed. Beneath each forum, all of your usergroups are listed.

The color of each usergroup is significant. If the usergroup text is in white, it is using the default permissions for the group. If the usergroup text is in red, it is using permissions customized for that forum. If it is in yellow, it is using custom permissions from a parent forum. If you are using Internet Explorer 4+ or Netscape 6+, the circle next to each usergroup name is also significant. A hollow circle means the usergroup cannot view the forum, while a full circle means they can.

To edit the permissions for any group, or to revert them to default, click Edit next to the appropriate group under the appropriate forum.

The Permission Duplicator, accessible from the link at the top of this screen, allows you to quickly duplicate an existing permission set between usergroups or between forums. (see Using the Permission Duplicator)

You can also access the Quick Editor from here. The Quick Editor allows you to quickly revert permissions to default. (see Using the Quick Editor)

The last link at the top is Quick Forum Setup. You can use this to mass-apply permissions to multiple usergroups for a particular forum. (see Using Quick Forum Setup)

helptopic.title: Permissions Quick Editor
helptopic.text: Below is a list of all sets of custom forum permissions. To delete a set of custom permissions simply check the corresponding check box on the left and then click the "Delete Selected Permissions" button at the bottom. To edit the permissions for an existing set simply click the corresponding [Edit] link on the right.

helptopic.title: Using the Quick Editor
helptopic.text: From this screen you quickly revert custom permissions to default by selecting the checkboxes of the forums you wish to revert and clicking Delete Selected Permissions. You can also edit a particular set of permissions by clicking Edit across from the forum and usergroup combination you wish to edit.

helptopic.title: Using Quick Forum Setup
helptopic.text:
On this screen, you can quickly apply basic permissions to multiple forums and multiple groups at the same time. Not all available permissions are shown on this screen, but these cover the basic functions, such as viewing, posting, and downloading attachments.

Start by selecting the forum to which these permissions should apply. Note that this will also apply (though inheritance) to any subforums of the selected forum, unless such forums already have custom permissions set for them. Existing permissions for the selected forum will be overwritten.

Next select which usergroup(s) these permissions should apply to. You can select any number that you wish.

Finally, set the actual permissions. You can use the All Yes or All No buttons to quickly change all of the radio buttons. Click Save Changes to apply the new permissions.

helptopic.title: Apply Permissions to Forum
helptopic.text: Select the forum you want these permissions to apply to. Keep in mind that permissions are inherited by child forums, so if you want a child of this forum to have different permissions then you will need to edit that forum's permissions separately.

helptopic.title: Apply Permissions to Usergroups
helptopic.text: Check all usergroups you want these permissions to apply to for this forum. Any previously set permissions for the selected groups for this forum will be overwritten with the new permissions below.

helptopic.title: Action
helptopic.text: This is the current action that you are adding help for. Examples are add, edit, modify. You can tell the current action by placing the forums in debug mode and looking at the browser's status bar. It will say $_REQUEST[do]='XXXX'. The XXXX is the action.

helptopic.title: Display Order
helptopic.text: This field allows you to sort multiple help entries into a logical order.

helptopic.title: Option
helptopic.text: This refers to the individual element on the page. You can determine this by hovering over the input elements. The option name will appear in the tooltip that appears as name="XXXXXX". Where XXXXXX is the input item's name.

helptopic.title: Product
helptopic.text: Use this field to attach an admin help item to a particular product or plugin.

helptopic.title: Script
helptopic.text: This is the name of the script which you want to add help for. Use the script name minus the extension. I.E. forum instead of forum.php.

helptopic.title: Text
helptopic.text: This is where you enter your actual help entry. If you need more space, click the "Large Edit Box" button to open up a secondary window.

helptopic.title: Title
helptopic.text: Specify a title for the admin help entry you are adding or editing.

helptopic.title: vBulletin Default
helptopic.text: If set to 'Yes', this item will be replaced and or upgraded by future vBulletin upgrade scripts.

helptopic.title: About Avatars, Post Icons, and Smilies
helptopic.text:
Related General Help Topics:
Avatars, Post Icons, and Smilies
Avatar Storage

Avatars, Post Icons, and Smilies:
The same system is used to manage avatars, post icons, and smilies. The help topics in this section apply to the Avatar Manager, Post Icon Manager, and Smilie Manager. Avatars, post icons, and smilies are referred to as "images" in these help topics.

vBulletin's image system is used to manage avatars, post icons, and smilies. These images can be arranged into categories and their access restricted by post count and usergroup. Usergroup restrictions are set at the category level while post count restrictions are set at the image level. To have access to an image category the user must be a member of at least one group (either primary or secondary group membership) that has access, as is explained in the general help topic for Usergroups.

helptopic.title: Add New Avatar / Post Icon / Smilie
helptopic.text:
This screen allows you to add one or more images at a time. These images must already reside on the server, having been uploaded by FTP or some other means prior to doing this.

You can either add a single image or add multiple images at the same time.

helptopic.title: Path to Images
helptopic.text:
This is the path to the images you are adding. This should be relative from your main vBulletin directory. For example, if your directory structure looks like this:
- vBulletin
-- images
--- avatars
--- icons
--- smilies
and you were uploading a smiley, you would type
images/smilies
Do not put a filename on this path, and do not put a trailing slash on it either.

helptopic.title: Number of Images to Display Per Page
helptopic.text: This is the number of images to display per page while adding them.

helptopic.title: Title
helptopic.text: This is the title of the image and will be displayed with the image (except in the case of smilies).

helptopic.title: Minimum Posts to Use this Avatar
helptopic.text:
This is the minimum number of a posts a user must have before he will be allowed to select this avatar.
This only applies to Avatars

helptopic.title: Text to Replace
helptopic.text:
This is what the user will type to have transformed into a smilie. For example :) or :( - keep in mind, this is case-sensitive. S:) and s:) are not the same thing.
This only applies to Smilies

helptopic.title: Path
helptopic.text:
This is the path to the image. This should be relative from your main vBulletin directory. For example, if your directory structure looks like this:
- vBulletin
-- images
--- avatars
--- icons
--- smilies

and your smiley was called tongue.gif and located in the smilies directory, you would specify:
images/smilies/tongue.gif

helptopic.title: Image Category
helptopic.text: This is the category to which the image will be added. It can be changed later.

helptopic.title: Display Order
helptopic.text: This determines the order in which images are shown. This can be changed later.

helptopic.title: Add New Avatar / Post Icon / Smilie Category
helptopic.text: On this screen you can add an image category. Images are displayed by category and you can set permissions per category as to who can use them (except for smilies).

helptopic.title: Title
helptopic.text: This is the title of the category. It is displayed with the images in the category to your users.

helptopic.title: Display Order
helptopic.text: This determines in what order categories are displayed to the user.

helptopic.title: Edit Avatar / Post Icon / Smilie
helptopic.text: This page allows you to edit the settings for this image. If you have any questions about specific settings please see the individual help topics.

helptopic.title: Edit Avatar / Post Icon / Smilie Category
helptopic.text: On this screen you can edit an existing image category. Images are displayed by category and you can set permissions per category as to who can use them (except for smilies).

helptopic.title: Avatar / Post Icon / Smilie Permissions
helptopic.text: Image categories can be restricted by usergroup on this page. Simply select "Yes" for groups whom you want to have access to this category and select "No" for groups you don't.

helptopic.title: Avatar / Post Icon / Smilie Manager
helptopic.text:
You can manage your images here. Images can be arranged in categories and their access restricted by post count and usergroup. Usergroup restrictions are set at the category level while post count restrictions are set at the image level.

At the bottom of this page you can click the [Add New Category] link to create a new category for images to go into. Click the [Show All] link to view all images for all categories.
