Below is a list of your image categories. The "Title" column tells you the name of each category. You can click on the category name to view its images.

The "Contains" column tells you how many images are in the corresponding category.

The "Display Order" column tells you the display order of each image category. The display order is used to order the image category listing in this Image Manager as well as on your forums. You can update the display orders shown on this page by changing the number values and clicking the "Save Display Order" button.

On the right side you will find several options for each image category. The [Mass Move] link takes you to a page where you can select a new category for each image in the corresponding category and submit the changes all at once.

The [View] link does the same thing as clicking on the category name to the left, it takes you to a page where you can view all images in the corresponding category.

The [Edit] link allows you to edit the title and display order of the corresponding category.

The [Delete] link takes you to a page where you can delete the corresponding category and all of its images or mass move the categories images to another category and then delete the original category.

The [Permissions] link takes you to a page where you can specify which usergroups can use the images in the corresponding category.

helptopic.title: Delete Avatar / Post Icon / Smilie
helptopic.text: This is a confirmation that you want to delete this image. Click the "Yes" button below to perform the deletion. This action cannot be undone.

helptopic.title: Delete Avatar / Post Icon / Smilie Category
helptopic.text: This page provides you with options for deleting this category. First of all, you can choose to delete all images in this category or not. And second, if you do not choose to delete all images in this category then you can select another category to which this categories images will be moved.

helptopic.title: Upload Avatar / Post Icon / Smilie
helptopic.text: On this screen, you can upload one image at a time through your browser for use on your forum. To do this, both your web server and PHP must have permission to write files to disk. If they do not, this will fail. The directory that you are trying to put the file in must be CHMODed 777 (consult your FTP program documentation for how to do this).

helptopic.title: Smilie File Path
helptopic.text: This is the file path that smilies will be uploaded to and read from. This file path should be readable AND writeable by your web server (usually chmod 0777) so that they may be uploaded and displayed.

helptopic.title: Filename
helptopic.text: Here you can select the file to upload.

helptopic.title: Image file
helptopic.text: This is where you select the file from your computer to be uploaded.

helptopic.title: View Avatars / Post Icons / Smilies
helptopic.text:
Below is a gallery of images for the category you selected. If there are more images in this gallery than are allowed per page (setting at the bottom of the page) then you will see page links at the bottom of the page. You can click the page links to view the rest of the images in this gallery.

At the bottom of this page you will see two links. Click the [Add] link to add a new image to your forums. Click the [Edit Categories] link to return to the Image Manager.

Viewing Images:
If you are viewing images then each image shown in the gallery below will have options associated with it. Click the [Edit] button to edit the settings for the corresponding image. Click the [Delete] link to delete the corresponding image.

The numbers under each image are the display orders of the images. These display orders are used to order the listing of images in this Image Manager as well as on the forums. You can change the displays orders on this page by changing the numbers and clicking the "Save Display Order" button at the bottom.

Mass Moving Images:
If you are mass moving images then each image shown in the gallery below will have a menu below it. Select a category from the menu under each image. When you click the "Mass Move" button the images below will be moved to the categories you selected.

Leave the menu set to the "blank" option if you don't want to move an image. If you want to move all images on this page to the same category then you can select that category in the menu at the bottom which will cause all menus on the page to be set to the category you choose.

helptopic.title: Control Panel Home
helptopic.text:
On this page you can view several quick stats about your forums and server as well as use the quick admin features which include: Quick User Finder, PHP Function Lookup, MySQL Language Lookup, and Useful Links. At the bottom of this page are the vBulletin credits.

If you have permission to run the "top" command on your server then you will see your server load averages under the "Quick Administration Links" section on this page. Click here for a detailed explanation of load averages.

The Quick User Finder allows you to quickly search for users based on a partial or exact username match.

The PHP Function Lookup will search the functions on the PHP site for the search string you enter. The results will be displayed in this frame.

The MySQL Language Lookup will search the documentation on the MySQL site for the search string you enter. The results will be displayed in this frame.

The Useful Links menu contains several useful vBulletin, PHP, and MySQL links that will open in a new window when you select their menu item.

helptopic.title: About Languages
helptopic.text:
Related General Help Topics:
Languages
Phrases

Languages:
vBulletin's language system allows you to translate your forum into other languages without editing any templates or files. This is thanks to the phrase system (see "Phrases" link above) which makes vBulletin's templates language-independent. The end result is that you can serve multiple languages from a single style.

Each phrase can have a translation for each language specified in this Language Manager. When a forum page is loaded, vBulletin checks what language the current logged in user has selected and parses the phrase variables into the appropriate translated text.

In addition to translated phrases, vBulletin's language system supports translated images (by allowing you to override a style's images folder setting), and language-specific date / time / number formats.

helptopic.title: Creating a New Language
helptopic.text: On this screen you can add a new language. From there you will be able to translate all phrases into this language just as with the default languages that come with vBulletin.

helptopic.title: Language Name
helptopic.text: This is the name of the language as displayed in the Administration area as well as to users.

helptopic.title: Allow user selection?
helptopic.text: If this is set to No, users will not be able to select this language (it will not appear to them). This is useful if you are just adding a language but have not yet added any translations for it.

helptopic.title: Text Direction
helptopic.text: Is this language read from left to right or from right to left?

helptopic.title: Language Code
helptopic.text: There is a standard code for every language. See this site for a list of language codes.

helptopic.title: HTML Character Set
helptopic.text:
This is the value of the 'charset' attribute for the HTML content type setting in the 'headinclude' template. Languages require specific charset definitions to support the encoding that is required for the unique characters of the language.

Setting this to ISO-8859-1 results in this charset being specified:

<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1" />

helptopic.title: Button Images Folder Override
helptopic.text:
Several vBulletin images have language-specific text in them. This option lets you use images made for a different language. These images are contained in the button images folder, which is images/buttons by default.

You may use <#> to represent the style ID the user is currently using. This allows you to support different styles for this language. For example, you can name the images folder something like images_name of language_style ID of style and then set this setting to images_name of language_<#>

helptopic.title: Locale
helptopic.text: You can define a locale or just specify the correct date and time formats in the settings below. Since locales are not supported on all systems it is better to manually specify the correct date and time formats if you can.

helptopic.title: Date Format Override
helptopic.text:
This setting will override the date format that is specified in your vBulletin options, here. Leave blank to use the format that is set in your vBulletin options.

If you have defined a locale for this language, consult this page for a list of date variables. If there is no locale defined for this language, consult this page for a list of date variables. You can use these variables in combination with other characters to define a format.

For example, European format (e.g., 25-04-98): %d-%m-%y ('d-m-y' with no locale defined)

If you have defined a locale for this language then you can use %x to let the locale decide what format to use.

helptopic.title: Time Format Override
helptopic.text:
This setting will override the time format that is specified in your vBulletin options, here. Leave blank to use the format that is set in your vBulletin options.

If you have defined a locale for this language, consult this page for a list of time variables. If there is no locale defined for this language, consult this page for a list of time variables. You can use these variables in combination with other characters to define a time format.

For example, AM/PM Time Format (eg, 11:15 PM): %I:%M %p (h:i A with no locale defined)

If you have defined a locale for this language then you can use %X to let the locale decide what format to use.

helptopic.title: Registration Date Format Override
helptopic.text:
This setting will override the registration date format that is specified in your vBulletin options, here. Leave blank to use the format that is set in your vBulletin options.

If you have defined a locale for this language, consult this page for a list of date variables. If there is no locale defined for this language, consult this page for a list of date variables. You can use these variables in combination with other characters to define a time format. See the "Date Format Override" and "Time Format Override" settings above for examples.

helptopic.title: Birthday Date Format Override
helptopic.text:
This setting will override the birthday with year format that is specified in your vBulletin options, here. Leave blank to use the format that is set in your vBulletin options.

If you have defined a locale for this language, consult this page for a list of date variables. If there is no locale defined for this language, consult this page for a list of date variables. You can use these variables in combination with other characters to define a time format. See the "Date Format Override" and "Time Format Override" settings above for examples.

helptopic.title: Birthday Date Format Override
helptopic.text:
This setting will override the birthday without year format that is specified in your vBulletin options, here. Leave blank to use the format that is set in your vBulletin options.

If you have defined a locale for this language, consult this page for a list of date variables. If there is no locale defined for this language, consult this page for a list of date variables. You can use these variables in combination with other characters to define a time format. See the "Date Format Override" and "Time Format Override" settings above for examples.

helptopic.title: Log Date Format Override
helptopic.text:
This setting will override the log date format that is specified in your vBulletin options, here. Leave blank to use the format that is set in your vBulletin options.

If you have defined a locale for this language, consult this page for a list of date variables. If there is no locale defined for this language, consult this page for a list of date variables. You can use these variables in combination with other characters to define a time format. See the "Date Format Override" and "Time Format Override" settings above for examples.

helptopic.title: Decimal Separator
helptopic.text: Use this setting to customize the way floating point (decimal) numbers are displayed for this language.

helptopic.title: Thousands Separator
helptopic.text: Use this setting to customize the way every thousands place is separated in large numbers for this language.

helptopic.title: Directional Markup Fix
helptopic.text:
When Right-to-Left and Left-to-Right characters are mixed on the same page, undesirable output can occur. This option adds hidden directional markup cues to several places where this problem is known to occur in vBulletin.

The problem usually manifests itself when RTL user names and thread titles are used on a LTR forum (and vice versa). If you do not expect this to be an issue then leave this option disabled.

helptopic.title: Delete Language
helptopic.text: This page allows you to delete this language. Click the "Yes" button below to delete this language. This action cannot be undone.

helptopic.title: Editing Phrases
helptopic.text:
On this screen you can edit, or translate, phrases. A phrase is a bit of text, referred to in the templates. Each language you have consists of all phrases translated into that language.

Each phrase row gives the phrase name (that is, how it is shown in the templates), the phrase as it exists for that language (translated or not), and a link to revert a phrase to the default (English) value. Make sure to click Save Changes to save your work on this page.

helptopic.title: Edit Language Settings
helptopic.text: On this screen you can edit the settings for a particular language.

helptopic.title: Is Default Language
helptopic.text:
If this is set to Yes, this language will be the default for forum members who do not select a language during registration, and for those who have not registered.

You can also change the default on the Language Manager screen.

helptopic.title: Downloading and Uploading Language Sets
helptopic.text:
On this screen you have the ability to upload and download language sets for your vBulletin. A language set is a collection of all of the phrases used within vBulletin and can be downloaded from the vBulletin.org and vBulletin.com forums.

You can also download a language set from your vBulletin to share with others if you have translated the vBulletin user interface into another language.

helptopic.title: Language to Download
helptopic.text: Select the language you wish to download from this list of all languages installed in your vBulletin.

helptopic.title: Product
helptopic.text: Select the vBulletin product for which you want to download.

helptopic.title: Filename for your language file.
helptopic.text: This is what your file will be named when you download it. It is suggested that you name it with something regarding the language you are downloading.

helptopic.title: Just fetch phrases
helptopic.text: By "language settings" we mean the settings you see when you click the [Edit Settings] link in the Language Manager. If this language is just translated phrases and no custom settings then you can select "Yes" here. Otherwise you should select "No" to keep the language whole as it is now.

helptopic.title: XML Language File to upload
helptopic.text: Select the XML language file to upload from your computer.

helptopic.title: Import XML File
helptopic.text:
Enter a file name complete with a server path that is relative to your main forum directory.

For example, if the name of the language file is vbulletin-language.xml and you uploaded it to the install directory inside your main forum directory then you would enter this value: ./install/vbulletin-language.xml

helptopic.title: Overwrite language
helptopic.text: If you wish to overwrite an existing language with the file you are uploading, select it from this menu. Otherwise make sure (create new language) is selected.

helptopic.title: Title For New Language
helptopic.text: This is what your language will be called on the forum. If you are overwriting a language, that language will be renamed with this title; otherwise, your new language will be named with this title.

helptopic.title: Use language file even if it was created for a different version of vBulletin?
helptopic.text:
If this is set to Yes, you will not receive a warning if this language set was created for a different version of vBulletin than you are running.

Typically it is ok to use language files from newer versions but not from older versions. The reason is that newer versions may have extra phrases that your version doesn't have, but at least it will have all of the phrases that yours does, whereas an older version might not.

helptopic.title: Modifying Languages
helptopic.text:
On this screen, a list of all languages you have installed is shown. Next to each language is a drop-down menu containing a series of phrase-editing options, as well as links to modify the language settings and download it.

Selecting an item on the (edit) drop-down list will take you to edit the type of phrase you select, e.g. Privatemessage related phrases, or Error phrases, etc.

Clicking Settings takes you to edit the settings of the language.

Delete removes the language from your vBulletin

Download lets you download a language set, which consists of all phrases you have translated for that language. You can distribute this to fellow vBulletin owners.
The 'Set Default' button allows you to set a language as the default for your forum. The default language is what is shown to registered forum members who did not select a language at registration, and to unregistered users or those who are not logged in.

At the bottom of the list are links to add a new language and download or upload existing language sets.

helptopic.title: Rebuild Languages
helptopic.text: This page is a confirmation and report of your languages being rebuilt. Click the "Done" button to return to the language manager.

helptopic.title: About Update Counters
helptopic.text:
Related General Help Topics:
Database Backup
Repair / Optimize
Update Counters
Diagnostics
Execute SQL Query

Update Counters:
This page allows you to update several vBulletin counters. Not all information that is displayed on vBulletin forum pages is dynamically generated. "Counters" are used instead of some costly queries in order to reduce the server load associated with retrieving information.

User post counts are a good example of a counter. vBulletin doesn't count the number of posts a user has every time their post count is displayed on the forums. Instead the user has a post counter that is incremented every time they make a post. This way when vBulletin wants to display a user's post count it only has to read a number instead of all of the records in the post table.

helptopic.title: Update Counters
helptopic.text:
This page contains several counters that you can update.

Update Forums:
This feature will update the information for each forum including: last post info, thread count, and post count. This may need to be done after mass moving / pruning threads and posts.

Update User Titles and Ranks:
This will go through every user on your forums and determine their correct user title and rank. This may need to be done after changing your user title ladder or user ranks.

Update User Names:
This will update user names everywhere they occur on your forums. This may need to be done after changing a user's name in the Admin CP.

Update Post Counts:
This will update the number of posts for each user by counting each user's posts in the database. If you have artificially inflated / deflated a user's post count by editing their profile in the Admin CP then this will reset it to its true value.

Fix broken user profiles:
Incomplete profiles are usually the result of hacks making user insertions from outside of vBulletin. Run this to fix any broken profiles.

Rebuild Forum Information:
This feature will update your forum counters and check for orphan moderators. This may need to be run after managing your forums.

Rebuild Thread Information:
This feature will update your thread counters including: last post info, reply count, view count, etc. You may need to run this after moving / pruning threads and posts.

Rebuild Similar Threads:
This feature will run a similar thread search for all threads on your forums. To show similar threads you need to enable the option in your vBulletin options. If you want your forums to search for similar threads when a new thread is posted (rather than having to update this counter later) then you need to enable the option on this page.

Rebuild Search Index:
This needs to be done after changing the max / min search word length in your vBulletin options.

Rebuild Statistics:
This feature rebuilds the information that is displayed on your Statistics page.

Rebuild Post Cache:
vBulletin doesn't parse BB code in posts every time they are displayed. Instead the parsed posts are saved in the "postparsed" table. In this way vBulletin reduces the processing time needed to display a post. Update this counter to rebuild the parsed posts. This needs to be done after changing BB code tags, posting allowances (like HTML code), etc.

Delete Duplicate Threads:
Sometimes duplicate threads are created during the posting process. Updating this counter will remove those duplicates.

Rebuild Styles:
Update this counter to rebuild your style structure.

Rebuild Attachment Thumbnails:
Rebuilding thumbnails is necessary after changing your thumbnail settings in your vBulletin options.

Rebuild User Reputation:
You need to update this counter if you change the default reputation value in your vBulletin options.

Remove Orphan Threads:
This function will delete any threads that belong to forums that no longer exist. Such threads are not accessible via the forums but they do add to your totals. You will see the number of orphan threads in parenthesis.

Remove Orphan Posts:
This function will delete any posts that belong to threads that no longer exist. Such posts are not accessible via the forums but they do add your your totals. You will see the number of orphan posts in parenthesis.

helptopic.title: Quality of JPG Thumbnails
helptopic.text: This determines the quality of the thumbnails that are generated. A higher value will result in better quality thumbnails. A lower value will require less storage.

helptopic.title: Number of forums to process per cycle
helptopic.text: Here you can specify the number of forums / users / threads / posts / attachments to be processed at a time. This number may need to be set lower for extremely large forums because of time out concerns.

helptopic.title: Post ID to start at
helptopic.text: The post ID to start indexing at. If you were re-indexing and the process stopped for some reason, you can resume where you left off.

helptopic.title: Total number of posts to process
helptopic.text: Here you can specify the total number of posts to process, starting at the starting post ID specified above.

helptopic.title: Include automatic JavaScript redirect to next page
helptopic.text: If set to 'Yes', the script will automatically continue on to the next cycle when the current cycle is finished. You should set this to 'Yes' unless you want to manually tell the script to continue at the end of each cycle.

helptopic.title: Check For Styles With No Parent
helptopic.text: Styles with no parent are broken. This option checks for those broken styles.

helptopic.title: Renumber all templates from 1
helptopic.text: Renumbers the template IDs to be in consecutive sequential order. This has no functional purpose except for freeing up template IDs so you don't run out.

helptopic.title: Base Reputation Value
helptopic.text: All users with reputations greater than or equal to this value will be processed.

helptopic.title: About Moderating Content
helptopic.text:
Moderating Content:
vBulletin allows you to moderate forum content before it is publicly displayed. This is useful in preventing inappropriate or unworthy content from being posted in forums whose content needs to be of a minimum quality. This section of the Admin CP allows you to moderate content that is awaiting moderation.

Thread, post, and attachment moderation can be enabled at the forum level (see the Forum Manager), the group level (see the Usergroup Manager), and at the group level for a specific forum (see Forum Permissions). Similarly, event moderation can be enabled at the group level and at the calendar level (see the Calendar Manager).

helptopic.title: Moderate Attachments
helptopic.text:
This page allows you to moderate attachments that are awaiting moderation. Below are all attachments that are awaiting moderation (if any). Select an action for each attachment (validate, delete, or ignore) and click the "Save" button to continue.

Validating an attachment removes it from this moderation queue and makes it visible on the forums. Deleting an attachment does exactly that. Ignoring an attachment leaves it in this moderation queue so you can handle it another time.

If you want to validate, delete, or ignore all attachments awaiting moderation then you can click the appropriate button at the top which sets all actions appropriately.

helptopic.title: Action
helptopic.text: Select an action to take for this attachment. Validating an attachment removes it from this moderation queue and makes it visible on the forums. Deleting an attachment does exactly that. Ignoring an attachment leaves it in this moderation queue so you can handle it another time.

helptopic.title: Moderate Events
helptopic.text:
This page allows you to moderate events that are awaiting moderation. Below are all events that are awaiting moderation (if any). Select an action for each event (validate, delete, or ignore) and click the "Save" button to continue.

Validating an event removes it from this moderation queue and makes it visible on the calendar. Deleting an event does exactly that. Ignoring an event leaves it in this moderation queue so you can handle it another time.

If you want to validate, delete, or ignore all events awaiting moderation then you can click the appropriate button at the top which sets all actions appropriately.

You can edit the content of events on this page while moderating them. For example, an event might have an inappropriate title... just change the text for the title and then validate the event.

helptopic.title: Subject
helptopic.text: This is the subject of this event. If the subject is not appropriate or you want to change it, simply edit this field before validating the event.

helptopic.title: Event
helptopic.text: This is the message for this event. You have the option of editing the message before validating this event. Simply change the message in this textarea before validating the event.

helptopic.title: Action
helptopic.text: Select an action to take for this event. Validating an event removes it from this moderation queue and makes it visible on the forums. Deleting an event does exactly that. Ignoring an event leaves it in this moderation queue so you can handle it another time.

helptopic.title: Moderate Threads / Posts
helptopic.text:
This page allows you to moderate threads and posts that are awaiting moderation. Below are all threads and posts that are awaiting moderation (if any). Select an action for each thread and post (validate, delete, or ignore) and click the "Save" button to continue.

Validating a thread or post removes it from this moderation queue and makes it visible on the forums. Deleting a thread or post does exactly that. Ignoring a thread or post leaves it in this moderation queue so you can handle it another time.

If you want to validate, delete, or ignore all threads and posts awaiting moderation then you can click the appropriate button at the top which sets all actions appropriately.

You can edit the content of threads and posts on this page while moderating them. For example, a thread might have an inappropriate title... just change the text for the title and then validate the thread.

helptopic.title: Title
helptopic.text: This is the title of this thread. If the title is not appropriate or you want to change it, simply edit this field before validating the thread.

helptopic.title: Message
helptopic.text: This is the message for this thread. You have the option of editing the message before validating this post. Simply change the message in this textarea before validating the thread.

helptopic.title: Notes
helptopic.text: The notes field records any moderative action that is made on this thread. You may want to enter a comment about this thread in the notes for reference.

helptopic.title: Action
helptopic.text: Select an action to take for this thread. Validating a thread removes it from this moderation queue and makes it visible on the forums. Deleting a thread does exactly that. Ignoring a thread leaves it in this moderation queue so you can handle it another time.

helptopic.title: Title
helptopic.text: This is the title of this post. If the title is not appropriate or you want to change it, simply edit this field before validating the thread.

helptopic.title: Message
helptopic.text: This is the message for this post. You have the option of editing the message before validating this post. Simply change the message in this textarea before validating the post.

helptopic.title: Action
helptopic.text: Select an action to take for this post. Validating a post removes it from this moderation queue and makes it visible on the forums. Deleting a post does exactly that. Ignoring a post leaves it in this moderation queue so you can handle it another time.

helptopic.title: About Moderators
helptopic.text:
Related General Help Topics:
Forums
Forum Permissions
Moderators
Viewing Permissions

Moderators:
Moderators can be added to forums to help you manage your forum content. Moderator privileges should only be given to users whom you trust.

Moderators can perform several actions on threads including but not limited to: closing threads (thread no longer open for replies), moving / copying threads to other forums, sticking threads (stays at the top of the forum listing), editing threads, deleting threads, merging threads (two threads become one), splitting threads (one thread becomes two).

helptopic.title: Add New Moderator
helptopic.text: On this page you can add a new forum moderator. Below is a list of permissions and options you can set for this moderator.

helptopic.title: Change Moderator's Primary Usergroup
helptopic.text: This option allows you to change this user's primary usergroup upon making them a moderator. Often times it is convenient to have your moderators in a specific usergroup for the purpose of giving them special permissions.

helptopic.title: Make Moderator a Member of
helptopic.text: This option allows you to specify additional usergroups to make this user a member of upon making them a moderator.

helptopic.title: Forum Moderated
helptopic.text: This is the forum that the user will moderate. Keep in mind that any child forums of this will also be moderated by this user.

helptopic.title: Moderator Usernames
helptopic.text:
Enter the username of the individual or individuals who will become moderators. Separate usernames using a semicolon.

If you specify an invalid username, none of the moderators will be added.

helptopic.title: Can Delete Albums/Pictures
helptopic.text: When this permission is set to "yes", allows the Moderator to delete any "Album" or "Picture" on the Board.

helptopic.title: Can Delete Picture Comments
helptopic.text: Whether this moderator has permission to soft-delete Picture Comments.

helptopic.title: Can Edit Picture Comments
helptopic.text: Whether this moderator has permission to edit Picture Comments.

helptopic.title: Can Moderate Picture Comments
helptopic.text: Whether this moderator has permission to moderate Picture Comments

helptopic.title: Can Moderate Pictures
helptopic.text: Whether this moderator has permission to moderate new Pictures.

helptopic.title: Can Physically Delete Picture Comments
helptopic.text: Whether this moderator has permission to physically remove Picture Comments from the database.

helptopic.title: Can Edit Posts
helptopic.text: This determines whether a moderator can edit other users' posts. They will still be able to edit their own posts (if their usergroup permission allows) even if you set this to No.

helptopic.title: Can Delete Posts
helptopic.text: This determines whether a moderator can delete and undelete posts.

helptopic.title: Can Physically Delete Posts
helptopic.text: There are two levels of deletion in vBulletin 3... deletion with the option to undelete, and complete physical deletion so the posts cannot be undeleted. This option has to do with the later.

helptopic.title: Can Open / Close Threads
helptopic.text: This permission determines whether or not this moderator can open and close threads. A closed thread appears with a lock on it and no one can reply to it except admins and mods.

helptopic.title: Can Edit Threads
helptopic.text: This permission determines whether or not this moderator can edit a thread's title and post icon.

helptopic.title: Can Manage Threads
helptopic.text:
This permission covers the rest of the thread permissions (stick, merge, split, etc).

Sticking a thread makes it so it always appears at the top of the thread listing. Merging allows a moderator to combine the posts of two threads into one thread. Splitting allows a moderator to split the posts from one thread into two threads.

helptopic.title: Can Edit Polls
helptopic.text: This permission determines whether or not this moderator can edit poll options and results within their forum.

helptopic.title: Can Post Announcements
helptopic.text:
This permission determines whether or not this moderator can post announcements in their forum.

This permission will allow this user to post announcements containing arbitrary HTML, which may be a security concern. Only grant this permission if you trust this person.

helptopic.title: Can Moderate Posts
helptopic.text: If post moderation is enabled in this moderator's forum, this permission will allow this moderator to approve posts awaiting moderation. The moderate will also be allowed to send posts back into moderation.

helptopic.title: Can Moderate Attachments
helptopic.text: If attachment moderation is enabled in this moderator's forum, this permission will allow this moderator to approve attachments awaiting moderation.

helptopic.title: Can Mass-Move Threads
helptopic.text: This permission allows this moderator to mass-move threads out of their forum.

helptopic.title: Can Mass-Prune Threads
helptopic.text: This permission allows this moderator to mass-prune threads from their forum.

helptopic.title: Can Set Forum Password
helptopic.text: If this forum has a password, this permission will allow this moderator to change this password.

helptopic.title: Can View IP Addresses
helptopic.text: Every post has an IP address recorded with it. This permission allows this moderator to click the IP address link in a post and view the IP address.

helptopic.title: Can View Whole User Profile
helptopic.text: This permission allows this moderator to view a user's entire profile, as it appears in the Admin CP. This does not give this moderator permission to edit a user's profile.

helptopic.title: Can Ban Users
helptopic.text: This permission allows this moderator to ban users, temporarily or permanently.

helptopic.title: Can Restore Banned Users
helptopic.text: This permission allows this moderator to unban users who are banned.

helptopic.title: Can Edit User Signatures
helptopic.text: This permission allows this moderator to edit users' signatures.

helptopic.title: Can Edit User Avatars
helptopic.text: This permission allows this moderator to edit users' avatars.

helptopic.title: Can Edit User Profile Pictures
helptopic.text: This permission allows this moderator to edit users' profile pictures.

helptopic.title: Can Edit User Reputation Comments
helptopic.text: This permission allows this moderator to edit reputation comments.

helptopic.title: Receive Email When a New Thread is Created
helptopic.text: Enabling this option will notify this moderator by email whenever a new thread is created. This is useful for low traffic forums that require close moderation.

helptopic.title: Receive Email When a New Post is Created
helptopic.text: Enabling this option will notify this moderator by email whenever a new post is made. This is useful for low traffic forums that require close moderation.

helptopic.title: Can Edit Posts
helptopic.text: When this permission is set to "yes", allows the Moderator to edit "Visitor Messages".

helptopic.title: Can Delete Posts
helptopic.text: When this permission is set to "yes", allows the Moderator to delete "Visitor Messages".

helptopic.title: Can Physically Delete Posts
helptopic.text: When this permission is set to "yes", allows the Moderator to remove "Visitor Messages" from the database.

helptopic.title: Can Moderate Posts
helptopic.text: When this permission is set to "yes", allows the Moderator to make "Visitor Messages" visible or invisible.

helptopic.title: Can Edit Groups
helptopic.text: When this permission is set to "yes", allows the Moderator to edit the title and description of any Group.

helptopic.title: Can Delete Groups
helptopic.text: When this permission is set to "yes", allows the Moderator to delete any Groups

helptopic.title: Can Edit Posts
helptopic.text: When this permission is set to "yes", allows the Moderator to edit "Group Messages".

helptopic.title: Can Delete Posts
helptopic.text: When this permission is set to "yes", allows the Moderator to delete "Group Messages".

helptopic.title: Can Physically Delete Posts
helptopic.text: When this permission is set to "yes", allows the Moderator to physically remove "Group Messages" from the database.

helptopic.title: Can Moderate Posts
helptopic.text: When this permission is set to "yes", allows the Moderator to make "Group Messages" visible or invisible.

helptopic.title: Can Edit Albums/Pictures
helptopic.text: When this permission is set to "yes", allows the Moderator to edit any "Album" or "Picture" on the Board.

helptopic.title: Edit Moderator
helptopic.text: This page allows you to edit this moderator. Below is a list of permissions that can be edited for this moderator.

helptopic.title: Can Delete Group Discussions
helptopic.text: If this is set to 'yes' the moderator will be able to delete discussions in Groups.

helptopic.title: Can Edit Group Discussions
helptopic.text: If this is set to 'yes' the moderator will be able to edit discussions in Groups.

helptopic.title: Can Moderate Group Discussions
helptopic.text: If this is set to 'yes' the moderator can send a discussion to the moderation queue.

helptopic.title: Can Physically Delete Discussions
helptopic.text: If this is set to 'yes' the moderator will be able to physically delete discussions from Groups so that they can not be restored later.

helptopic.title: Can Delete Discussions
helptopic.text: When this is set to "yes" the Moderator will be able to delete a discussion including all of it's posts. The discussion and it's posts can later be restored.

helptopic.title: Can Edit Discussions
helptopic.text: If this is set to "yes" the Moderator will be able to edit the first post of a discussion, including the title of the discussion.

helptopic.title: Can Moderate Group Discussions
helptopic.text: If this is set to 'yes' the moderator can moderate discussions.

helptopic.title: Can Physically Delete Discussions
helptopic.text: If this is set to "yes" the Moderator will be able to physically delete a discussion and all of it's posts from the database. The discussion and posts can not be restored!

helptopic.title: Can Transfer Groups
helptopic.text:
If this is set to "yes" the Moderator will be able to transfer ownership of any group to another user. Note that the transfer will only be completed upon the receipient's acceptance.

Additionally, the current owner of the group will receive a private message notifying them that the group has been transfered to another user.

helptopic.title: Delete Moderator
helptopic.text: This page allows you to delete this moderator. Click the "Yes" button below to perform the deletion. This action cannot be undone.

helptopic.title: Remove this Moderator from All Forums
helptopic.text: This page allows you to remove this user's moderatorship from all forums. Click the "Yes" button below to perform the removal.

helptopic.title: Show All Moderators
helptopic.text:
This page shows you all of your forum moderators and their last visit dates which helps you to identify inactive moderators.

Click the [Edit] link next to a moderator's forum to edit their moderator permissions for that forum. Click the [Delete] link next to a moderator's forum to revoke their moderatorship in that forum. Click the [Remove this Moderator from All Forums] link to do exactly that.

helptopic.title: About Moderator Log
helptopic.text:
Related General Help Topics:
Statistics
Control Panel Log
Moderator Log
Scheduled Task Log

Moderator Log:
The moderator log allows you to view the activities of your moderators. Each time a moderator action is performed on your forums it is recorded in the moderator log. The information stored includes the moderator's username, the date, the action performed, and additional information which varies depending on the action being performed.

helptopic.title: View / Prune Moderator Log
helptopic.text: This page allows you to view / prune log entries in the moderator log. If you have questions about specific options on this page please see the individual help topics below.

helptopic.title: Log Entries to Show Per Page
helptopic.text: This limits how many entries are shown on each page. If you have a slower connection it is recommended you select a lower number.

helptopic.title: Show Only Entries Generated By
helptopic.text: If you wish to only view / prune logs that were generated by the actions of one person, select their username here.

helptopic.title: Order By
helptopic.text: You can order the entries by date created, script accessed, or the user who performed the action.

helptopic.title: Remove Entries Older Than (Days)
helptopic.text: You can easily remove old logs using this option. Logs found that are older than this date will be removed.

helptopic.title: Prune Moderator Log
helptopic.text: This is a confirmation that you want to delete the matching log entries from the moderator log. Click the "Yes" button to perform the deletion.

helptopic.title: Viewing the Moderator Log
helptopic.text:
This screen shows you a portion of the log entries that have been made by your moderators while performing mod duties. From left to right, the columns tell you:

Log ID: This is simply an internal ID used for cataloging.

Username: This is the person who performed the action.

Date: This is the date and time the action was performed.

Action: This is the action that the user performed.

Extra Info: For some actions, this records extra bits, such as affected threads and forums.

At the bottom of the page, if there are more entries than could be displayed on one screen, you will find links to view the first page, previous page, next page, and last page. These buttons appear as necessary. For example if you are on the first page, the First Page and Previous Page buttons will not appear.

To return to the main screen, choose Restart from the bottom of any page.

You can restrict access to this script, or just to the pruning function or just to the viewing function. See Restricting Access to Admin Log.

helptopic.title: Notice Title
helptopic.text:
The title you specify here is used only in the Admin CP for management purposes and is never shown to visitors.

The text displayed here should be entered in the base language for your board. If you want to create versions for other languages you have enabled on your board, click the 'Translations' link.

helptopic.title: Notice HTML
helptopic.text:
This field contains the raw HTML of your notice. You may use any HTML you like - BB code is not accepted here.

If you want to refer by name to a user viewing your notice, include {username} or {musername} in the text of your notice and it will be replaced with the user's username when the message is displayed to them. {musername} will display their name with the markup specified by their usergroup.

You may also use {userid}, {sessionurl}, and {sessionurl_q} to assist in creating hyperlinks. {sessionurl_q} contains the session hash preceded by a question mark.

The text displayed here should be entered in the base language for your board. If you want to create versions for other languages you have enabled on your board, click the 'Translations' link.

helptopic.title: Display Order
helptopic.text: In addition to changing the order in which notices are displayed in the Notice Manager, this control also defines the order in which notices will be displayed to visitors.

helptopic.title: Active
helptopic.text: This is a quick switch to allow you to disable a notice without actually deleting it.

helptopic.title: Persistent
helptopic.text:
A notice that is not persistent will be displayed the first time a user visits the board and will then disappear until they visit again (it is displayed once per browser-session).

On the other hand, a Persistent notice is displayed whenever all of its conditions have been fulfilled.

helptopic.title: Display this notice if...
helptopic.text:
Here, there are listed a number of conditions you can set in order for your notice to be displayed.

To activate a criterion, check the checkbox next to its description, then enter the values you would like to use in the form fields for that criterion, if it has any.

All active criteria must be satisfied in order for a notice to be displayed.

For criteria that are of the form 'value is between x and y', the condition is inclusive. Therefore, if you have a criterion saying 'User has between 10 and 20 reputation points', a user with 10 or 20 reputation points or any value between would be shown the notice.

Additionally, these 'value is between x and y' criteria can be used as 'less than' or 'greater than' conditions. To do this, leave the first box totally empty to set a condition of 'less than the value in the second box', or leave the second box blank to use a condition of 'greater than the value in the first box'.

The 'Criteria for notice x are not met' condition is a special case. It works by looking back over the list of notices that have been selected for display, and then removing notices that are dependent on another notice not being matched for display.

Consider the following example:
  • Notices A, B and C exist.
  • Notice A is shown when visiting users belong to the 'Registered Users' group
  • Notice B is shown if criteria for notice A are not met
  • Notice C is shown if criteria for notice B are not met
  • A registered user views a page. Notice A is shown
  • Notice B is not shown, because the criteria for showing Notice A are met
  • Notice C is not shown, because (with the exception of the 'Criteria for notice x are not met' condition), Notice B would have been shown.
  • The final result is that only Notice A is shown. The same is true regardless of the order in which the notices are executed or displayed.

helptopic.title: Notices Manager
helptopic.text:
Here you see a list of all the notices you have currently defined on your system.

At the top of the list is a checkbox that allows you to toggle the 'Active' status of all notices with one click.

To edit a notice, click its title. To delete a notice, there is a 'Delete' link at the end of each notice's row in the manager.

Each notice is displayed with two checkboxes and a text box containing a number. These represent the Active status, the Persistent nature of the notice, and the notice's Display Order.

If a notice is not active, it will not be displayed to visitors under any circumstances.

A notice that is not persistent will be displayed the first time a user visits the board and will then disappear until they visit again (it is displayed once per browser-session).

The display order text box controls the order in which the notice is shown, both in the notices manager and to visitors. Display order also controls the order in which notices are checked, so it's important for the 'Notice x has not already been displayed' condition.

After using the Active, Persistent and Display Order controls, you need to click the 'Save' button to commit your changes.

helptopic.title: About vBulletin Options
helptopic.text:
vBulletin Options:
This section of the Admin CP contains all configurable vBulletin options. The options are categorized into groups whose names indicate what kind of options they contain.

When configuring these options you have the choice of displaying all options (there are a lot of them) for all groups or displaying the options for one group at a time. If you are going through all of the options after a fresh installation or upgrade from vBulletin 2 you may find it more convenient to display all options so you can configure and save everything all at once. Otherwise you can just open the group containing the options you want to configure.

If you are looking for a specific option and you don't know what group it's in, you can display all of the options and do a page search in your web browser. Internet Explorer users can press Ctrl - F to pull up a search box. Other browsers may be different.

helptopic.title: Modifying vBulletin Options
helptopic.text: On this screen you can select the group of options you wish to modify. You can also opt to view all settings on one screen by choosing Show All Settings. Internet Explorer users can double-click on their choice to be taken to that page automatically.

helptopic.title: Albums Per Page
helptopic.text:
When listing multiple albums on one page, this controls how many will be displayed before pagination occurs.

Note: This number must be at least 1.

helptopic.title: Picture Moderation
helptopic.text:
If set to 'Yes', all pictures uploaded to user albums are placed into a moderation queue for approval by board staff before being visible to site visitors.

It may be a legal requirement to enable this option in some cases, such as for boards run in Germany.

If you would like to have all images from only certain usergroups sent to the moderation queue, the usergroup editor provides this ability.

helptopic.title: Caption Preview Length
helptopic.text: When showing the list of pictures in an album, this option controls the amount of characters from a picture's caption that will be shown when a user hovers over the picture.

helptopic.title: Maximum Pictures per Album
helptopic.text:
This option allows you globally control how many pictures a user may place in an album. Users may create as many albums as they wish.

You may control how many pictures a user can upload to all of their albums via user group permissions.

helptopic.title: Pictures Per Page
helptopic.text:
When viewing an album, this controls how many pictures are displayed before pagination occurs.

Note: This number must be at least 1.

helptopic.title: Recent Album Update Days
helptopic.text:
You may set the amount of days that albums are relevant in the Recently Updated Albums list. You may want to increase this value if picture updates are infrequent, or vice versa.

If user album permissions are changed then the Recent Abum Updates list may contain albums that are no longer accessible. This can be fixed by rebuilding the list on the Rebuild Counters page.

helptopic.title: Number of Pictures that can be Uploaded Simultaneously
helptopic.text:
This controls the number of pictures users can upload simultaneously. They will not be able to violate any album- or usergroup-implied size limits if you set this value too large.

However, setting this to a large value may cause strain on your server if the uploaded pictures need to be resized or recompressed.

This value cannot go below 1.

helptopic.title: API Device Identification
helptopic.text: Threads and Posts generated with applications that utilize the vBulletin API can be publicly tagged and identified with a device signature that will appear in the post. You can add additional links to your Apple iTunes and/or Android Marketplace to promote your applications. If the option is enabled but the link definition is not defined, the signature will still appear on the post but not be clickable.

helptopic.title: Resize Images
helptopic.text:
This option will attempt to automatically resize image attachments that exceed the set dimensions for that specific image type. The image will be proportionately resized to the maximum dimensions for that image type. Resized images will be converted to JPG images to conserve space. Image types that can be resized depends on your server configuration. Resizing is as follows:

GD
JPEG => JPEG
PNG => JPEG
GIF => JPEG

Imagemagick
JPEG => JPEG
PNG => JPEG
GIF => JPEG
BMP => JPEG
TIFF => JPEG
PSD (N/A)*
PDF (N/A)*

*PSD and PDF image types are not resized as you would want to retain their current setting.

helptopic.title: Show Forum Link in Footer
helptopic.text: This option allows you to add a link to your forum overview in the footer on every page.

helptopic.title: Show Forum Link in Menu
helptopic.text: This option allows you to add an extra forum link to the navigation menu on every page. This may be useful if you have non forum products installed.

helptopic.title: Show Forum Link in Breadcrumb
helptopic.text: This option allows you to add an extra breadcrumb to the breadcrumb navigation to link to the forum overview. This may be useful if you have non forum products installed and the top link in the breadcrumb does not link to your forums.

helptopic.title: Always use Forum URL as Base Path
helptopic.text:
If this is set to 'Yes' the Forum URL will always be used for links instead of the current URL. This ensures that links are consistent but may not be desirable if you use multiple domains or a mix of http and https.
If this is set to 'No' then many links will be resolved from current URL. This is useful if you have subdomains, multiple domains or a mix of http and https pages.

helptopic.title: Bounce Email Address
helptopic.text:
When an email sent from vBulletin is returned (bounced) back from a server for whatever reason, internet standards dictate that there must be a valid email address to receive those bounce messages. This option should be used to provide that address.

If this field is left empty, the previously-specified 'Webmaster Email' address will be used automatically.

This email is used when using an SMTP server, or when the "Enable -f Parameter" email for sendmail is switched on.

helptopic.title: COPPA Registration System Cookie Check
helptopic.text:
This option will save a cookie onto the user's computer if an age under 13 is entered. Subsequent registration attempts will be failed, no matter what age is entered.

This will stop users from trying to register with an age older than 13. Users can still circumvent this check by manually removing the cookie.

helptopic.title: Show CMS Link in Footer
helptopic.text: This option allows you to add a link to the CMS Default Page in the footer on every page.

helptopic.title: Show CMS Link in Menu
helptopic.text: This option allows you to add a link to the CMS Default Page in the navigation menu on every page. This may be useful if the CMS is not your Homepage URL or you are not displaying your Homepage URL in the menu.

helptopic.title: Show CMS Link in Breadcrumb
helptopic.text: If this option is set to 'Yes' a link to the CMS Default Page will be included in the breadcrumb on every CMS page. This may be useful if your CMS is not used as your Homepage URL or you are not using Display Home Link on Breadcrumb.

helptopic.title: CMS Name
helptopic.text: The CMS name is included in the title of CMS pages. If this is left blank then the Forum Name will be used instead.

helptopic.title: Log Emails to a File
helptopic.text:
Enter a path here. For example, on a Windows server the path might be something like:

C:\logs\vbulletin.log

Or on a *nix server it might be something like:

/home/yoursite/logs/vbulletin.log

This option should only be enabled to troubleshoot email issues. Your server performance can decrease while this option is enabled.

helptopic.title: Cache Lifespan
helptopic.text: By default, content generated by external.php will be cached for one hour. This setting alleviates the problem of abusive users repeatedly requesting updates from external.php. Some RSS applications do not respect the 60 minute refresh request that vBulletin sends with the information.

helptopic.title: Maximum External Records
helptopic.text:
This option limits the maximum amount of records that can be returned by the external data provider. By default 15 records will be returned. This option allows the user to tackon &count=X to their RSS feed to retrieve more records.

Changing this value will not increase or decrease the amount of records that are returned by default. This option simply gives your users the ability to request more records if they desire by adding &tackon=X to their RSS feeds.

Enabling friendly URLs can increase your site's ranking in search engines and can be useful for users to understand the URL's that they follow.
  • Standard URLs:
    showthread.php?t=12345

  • Basic Friendly URLs:
    showthread.php?1234-Thread-Title

  • Advanced Friendly URLs:
    showthread.php/1234-Thread-Title

  • Mod Rewrite Friendly URLs:
    threads/1234-Thread-Title

Note: In order to use the Mod Rewrite Friendly URLs the appropriate rewrite rules must be defined for your server.

helptopic.title: Maximum Messages Per-Page
helptopic.text:
This setting allows you to limit the number of messages users may display per page in the groups.

Note: This number must be at least 1.

helptopic.title: Default Messages Per-Page
helptopic.text:
This setting allows you to define the default number of messages displayed per-page in groups.

Note: This number must be at least 1.

helptopic.title: Show Home Link in Footer
helptopic.text: This option allows you to add a link to the Homepage URL in the footer on every page. This option is enabled by default.

helptopic.title: Show Home Link in Menu
helptopic.text: This option allows you to add a link to the Homepage URL in the navigation menu. This may be useful if you have non forum products installed.

helptopic.title: Show Home Link in Breadcrumb
helptopic.text: This option ensures that a link to the Homepage URL is always included in the breadcrumb. This may be useful if you have non forum products installed.

helptopic.title: Human Verified Actions
helptopic.text:
Setting any of the options will require users with the usergroup permission Require Human Verification on Configured Actions to pass the Human Verification test when performing the selected actions.

If you select the "Post" action, the Quick Reply editor will be disabled when viewing threads.

helptopic.title: Session IP Octet Length Check
helptopic.text: This is used to specify to what length the session IP should be verified to, the most secure version is when an IP address is fully checked against the session stored IP though this can cause problems with certain ISP's. The security risk is however minimal as it involves being within a 254 range of the same connection.

helptopic.title: Disable Content Caching
helptopic.text: Some content is cached to speed up page load times. Disabling content caching forces content to be fetched directly and not from the cache. This should only be done for trouble shooting purposes.

helptopic.title: Forum Leaders Cache
helptopic.text: This sets the number of minutes that the forum leaders page is cached for. Caching this page can significantly improve its performance if you have a large number of users and usergroups. Setting the value to 0 will disable the cache.

helptopic.title: Paid Subscription Email Notification
helptopic.text: An email will be sent to this email address when a paid subscription is purchased or reversed.

helptopic.title: Allowed BB Code Tags in Picture Comments
helptopic.text:
Use this option to specify which (if any) BB code tags your visitors may use when composing picture comments.

By default, Basic (B, I, U), Color and Link (URL, EMAIL, THREAD, POST) tags are enabled.

helptopic.title: Enable Picture Comments
helptopic.text:
Picture comments are a messaging system associated with user-uploaded pictures in albums, which allow other users to comment on these pictures.

If you would like to enable this system, set this option to 'Yes'.

helptopic.title: Maximum Picture Comments Per-Page
helptopic.text:
In conjunction with the 'Default Picture Comments Per-Page' option, this setting allows you to limit the number of picture comments that can be shown on a single page when visitors manually change the per-page option.

Note: This number must be at least 1.

helptopic.title: Moderate Picture Comments
helptopic.text:
Setting this option to 'Yes' will force all new picture comments into a moderation queue so that they can be approved by board staff before appearing to the main visitorship of the board.

If you would prefer to specify which usergroups have their picture comments moderated, do this through the usergroup manager instead.

helptopic.title: Default Picture Comments Per-Page
helptopic.text:
If a picture has more comments than the number specified here, the comments will be split across multiple pages, with each page showing this number of comments.

Note: This number must be at least 1.

helptopic.title: Throttle Check Period
helptopic.text: This is the period of time of which throttle checking is performed. The amount of messages that a user can send within this period is defined by their Message Throttle Quantity usergroup permission. If this is set to 0 then private messages will not be throttled.

helptopic.title: Auto-Save Content
helptopic.text:
While users are writing messages, the in progress content can be automatically saved in case the user's browser crashes or the user mistakenly leaves the page. This covers all areas that utilize the vBulletin editor including: CMS Articles & Comments, Forum Threads & Posts, Calendar Events, Private Messages, Visitor Messages, Group Discussions, and so on. The auto-saved content is recoverable by a "Restore" button that appears at the bottom of the editor when there is content that can be used. Pressing the button will update the editor with the stored content, consisting of the editor message and the title, if applicable.
Auto-Saved content is specific to the area that it was saved from. A saved message from a new thread in forum "Welcome" will only be able to be restored when the user is creating a new thread in the "Welcome" forum.
The time between automatic saves is set in seconds. 20 seconds is the minimum value that will be accepted. If you wish to disable auto-save, set the value to 0.

helptopic.title: Post Edit History
helptopic.text:
If this setting is enabled each post is saved prior to being updated, this allows for a history to be shown for edited posts.

Edits will not be logged if an 'edited by' notice is not displayed or updated. This occurs in the following situations:
  • The editing user is in a group that does not show edited by notices and no reason for editing is specified.
  • The post is edited quickly enough after being posted to trigger the Time to Wait Before Starting to Display 'Last Edited by...' option.

helptopic.title: Guest Post Image Verification
helptopic.text: If you enable this option, guest users will be required to pass a test during posts where an image is displayed that has a random number on it, and the user must type in the number they see in order to prove they are not an automated system attempting to post. PHP must have GD support enabled for this option to work.

helptopic.title: Allow Users to Edit Profile Privacy
helptopic.text:
Setting this option to yes will allow users to customize the blocks on their profile page so that they are either hidden or shown to other users.

If enabled and the user has the 'Can Edit Profile Privacy' permission, the user can choose to hide blocks from their ignored users; unregistered users; users who are not on their contact list; and users who are not on their friends list.

Note: When enabled, the 'Profile Privacy' link on the User Control Panel allows users to customize their profile page in this way.

helptopic.title: Number of Albums to display in the Users Profile
helptopic.text: The Maximum Number of Albums to Display on the Users' Profile Pages

helptopic.title: Redirect Domain Whitelist
helptopic.text: For advanced domain configuration only! These are domain names that point to your forum in addition to the main Forum URL configured in vBulletin settings. These domains will be considered safe and allowed as redirection targets by the vBulletin software. This option should remain blank in most installations.

helptopic.title: Disable Redirect Domain Checking
helptopic.text: When this option is enabled, all redirected URLs will be allowed, regardless of what is defined in the "Redirect Domain Whitelist" option. Unless you are sure that this is desired, this option should be left disabled. Some add-on products may require this to work properly if the product has not been updated to work correctly with the "Redirect Domain Whitelist" option.

helptopic.title: Use Remote YUI
helptopic.text:
By default YUI (Yahoo! User Interface Library) script files are hosted locally on your server, you may however have them on a Content Distribution Network saving you some bandwidth and potentially decreasing load times.

These services are available for free from both Yahoo! and Google. If enabled the files will be served from their servers.

Only the Google service supports SSL hosting.

helptopic.title: Standard URL Routing Variable
helptopic.text:
When the Standard URLs Friendly URL option is selected, links may pass the path of the requested content as a variable in the URL. This options sets the variable that is used.

Ensure that this is not set to a variable used elsewhere by vBulletin, such as do, t, p or pp.

helptopic.title: Post Reporting Email
helptopic.text: If the option to email moderators is enabled, all moderators of the reported post's forum will be emailed a notice about the reported post. You may also choose to notify super moderators and administrators as well. If the moderator option is chosen and the forum has no moderators, super moderators and administrators will be emailed.

helptopic.title: Post Reporting Discussion Forum
helptopic.text: The Post Reporting system can automatically create a discussion thread for each reported post. When a post is reported multiple times, new posts will be added to the discussion thread.

helptopic.title: Post Reporting User
helptopic.text: If you enable this setting, Post Reporting discussion threads will be created under the set username. Otherwise the posts will be made under the name of the user reporting the post.

helptopic.title: Rss Enclosures (Podcasting)
helptopic.text: RSS Enclosure is a special tag that is added to the RSS2 feed that allows the first attachment to be served via 'podcasting'. The spec only supports one file per item, hence the limit to the first attachment. Many aggregates, including iTunes, will recognize your attachment and offer it for download when your RSS2 feed is opened. Some aggregates support all file types, while other support a limited set of files. iTunes only supports .m4a, .m4v, .mp3, .mp4, .mov, and .pdf. Within the forum manager, for each forum, you can define further iTunes specific settings that may also be supported by other aggregates.

helptopic.title: Maximum Discussions Per-Page
helptopic.text:
This setting allows you to limit the number of discussions users may display per page in a group.

Note: This number must be at least 1.

helptopic.title: Default Discussions Per-Page
helptopic.text:
This setting allows you to define the default number of discussions displayed per-page in a group.

Note: This number must be at least 1.

helptopic.title: Allowed BB Code Tags in Group Messages
helptopic.text:
Use this option to specify which (if any) BB code tags your visitors may use when composing group messages.
By default, Basic (B, I, U), Color and Link (URL, EMAIL, THREAD, POST) tags are enabled.

helptopic.title: Allow Owners to Delete Group if Empty
helptopic.text:
If this option is set to yes, the owner of a group will always be able to delete the group if there are no other members. This is independent of the user group permission. If you set this to no, user group permissions will always be respected.

Setting this to yes can allow users to clean up unpopular groups, but it can also create a loophole. An owner may be able to kick out all the members of a group and then delete it, thereby getting around the delete group permission.

helptopic.title: Allow Join-to-View Groups
helptopic.text:
With this option enabled, group owners may set up their groups in a manner that prevents non-members from viewing any of the group's content including messages and pictures.

If you do not want group owners to be able to do this, disable this option.

helptopic.title: Allow Groups Owners to Force New Group Messages into Moderation Queue
helptopic.text:
A group owner with the Manage Own Groups' Content usergroup permission will be able to create or edit their groups settings to force all new messages into the moderation queue with this setting enabled.

If they do this, messages will not appear to normal board users until approved by the group owner or other board staff member.

helptopic.title: Category Cloud Size
helptopic.text:
This setting allows you to define the number of categories to display in the Group Overview.

Note: This number must be at least 1.

helptopic.title: Enable Group Image Icons
helptopic.text:
If this is enabled users who create groups will be able to upload a group icon that will be displayed when viewing the group, and as a smaller version when viewing group listings.


Note: Group Image Icons are always limited to 200px by 200px and thumbnails are limited to 80px by 80px.

helptopic.title: Allow Group Owners to Limit New Discussions to Themselves
helptopic.text: If this is set to 'yes' then users with the 'Can Limit Discussions in Own Groups to the Group Owner' permission will be able to create Groups where only they can create new discussions. Other users will still be able to post messages in the discussions as normal.

helptopic.title: Maximum Groups Per-Page
helptopic.text:
This setting allows you to limit the number of groups users may display per page when listing groups.

Note: This number must be at least 1.

helptopic.title: Group Name Maximum Length
helptopic.text:
Enter a number of characters that define the maximum length for the name of user-created groups.

If a user enters a name longer than this limit, an error will be generated and the name will be rejected.

helptopic.title: Number of Newest Groups to Display
helptopic.text:
This setting allows you to define the number of groups displayed in the Newest Groups section of the Groups Overview.

Note: This number must be at least 1.

helptopic.title: Default Groups Per-Page
helptopic.text:
This setting allows you to define the default number of groups displayed per-page when searching groups.

Note: This number must be at least 1.

helptopic.title: Show Forum Button
helptopic.text: Selecting 'Yes' will show a link to the Forum Home on the navigation bar on all pages. This link will take the user to the forum overview, even if the Script for Forum Home Page does not.

helptopic.title: Use SkypeWeb Graphics
helptopic.text:
This is a three-way setting. Setting No will cause the Skype™ icon (used in the im_skype template) to be loaded from the local webserver. This can be useful as the SkypeWeb server has proven to be a little flakey at present.

If set to Yes, the icon will be loaded from the SkypeWeb server and will show the Skype™ online-status of the user in question.

Additionally, SkypeWeb offers the ability to display online status in non-English languages. This ability can be used on the 'Send message using Skype to user' page, to show whether or not the selected user is logged-in to Skype and available.

In order for this to work, this option must be set to Use Language-Specific SkypeWeb Graphics and the Language Code specified for vBulletin languages must be one of the following:
  • En
  • De
  • fr
  • it
  • pl
  • Ja
  • Pt
  • Pt/br
  • Se
  • zh
  • Cn
  • Zh/cn
  • hk
  • tw
  • Zh/tw
These language codes are not case-sensitive, and you may use a dash instead of a slash if you wish (pt-br instead of Pt/br).

helptopic.title: Enable Social Bookmarking
helptopic.text:
This is a global social bookmarking switch. If you disable this option, social bookmarking sites will not be listed at the bottom of the thread, regardless of the settings in the Social Bookmark Manager.

If you find that no social bookmarking links are being displayed in a thread, check the permissions for guests in that thread. The links will only be shown in guest-viewable threads.

helptopic.title: Enabled User Profile Features
helptopic.text:
These options are "on/off" switches for the different features within the Profile Page, including:
Groups
Enables or Disables the "Groups" feature Board Wide
Albums
Enables or Disables the "User Albums" feature within Board Wide
Friends
Enables or Disables the "Friends" feature Board Wide (Does not disable contacts and the ignore list feature)
Visitor Tracking
Enables or Disables the "Visitor Tracking" for User's Profiles
Visitor Messaging
Disables "Visitor Messaging" for User's Profiles

helptopic.title: Thread Tag Banned Words
helptopic.text:
When users create new tags, the words they choose are checked against a list specified in includes/searchwords.php, and against the list described in this setting.

If the word the user has chosen as their tag is found in either list, its use will be disallowed and the user will receive an error message stating that they can not use that word.

helptopic.title: Tag Cloud: Cache Time
helptopic.text: Time, in minutes, to keep the tag cloud data cached for. A value of 0 will disable the caching.

helptopic.title: Tag Cloud: Number of Levels
helptopic.text:
This is the number of sizes that tags are displayed in.

If you wish to increase this value above 5, you will need to edit the search_forums template and add additional CSS rules at the top.

helptopic.title: Enable Search Tag Cloud
helptopic.text: If you enable this option, a new tag cloud will be shown at the bottom of the advanced search page. This tag cloud differs from the version here because it is based on the amount of searches done for a particular tag instead of the number of times the tag is used.

helptopic.title: Search Tag Cloud: History (Days)
helptopic.text:
The number of days that tag searching information should be stored for. This information is used to build the tag cloud.

0 will keep data around permanently.

helptopic.title: Tag Cloud: Number of Tags
helptopic.text: The maximum number of tags that will be displayed in the tag cloud. A higher number provides more information to a user but may appear to be more cluttered.

helptopic.title: Tag Cloud: Usage History (Days)
helptopic.text:
This option controls the number of days worth of data that will be used to create the usage-based tag cloud shown here. Any tags added outside this range will not be taken into account for the tag cloud.

The tag cloud can serve as a list of what's popular on your site. You can use this option to prevent what was popular earlier from skewing against what's popular now.

helptopic.title: Tag Cloud: Build Usergroup
helptopic.text:
In order to prevent tags in private forums for modifying the data in the tag cloud, you may force the tag cloud to be built with the permissions of a particular usergroup. Tags will be only be counted for forums where that user can view all threads.

Choosing 'Live Permission Check' will prevent the tag cloud from being cached, but it will respect the permissions of the browsing user.

'No Permission Check' will skip the permission checking entirely. This is equivalent to picking a usergroup that has permissions to view all forums.

helptopic.title: Tag Separators
helptopic.text:
You may specify additional separators for tags. The comma is the default separator and cannot be removed, regardless of what is set here.

Simply place a space between each separator. For example, "| &" would mean that tags would be separated by a comma (,), pipe (|), or ampersand (&). Separators may be multiple characters, if desired.

If you wish to include a space as a separator or within a separator, you must wrap the separator in { and }. For example, to make space a separator, you would use "{ }". To put a space within a separator, you would use something like "{| |}"; this would mean that to separate tags you would have to use "| |".

Note that adding separators may make previous tags unusable. For example, if you had a tag "American cars" and added space as a separator, users that try to add that tag will add two tags, "American" and "cars".

When adding separators to this list, you may wish to modify the contents of two phrases to respect the additional separators:
  • separate_tags_using_comma
  • tag_no_comma

helptopic.title: Thread Tag Allowed Words
helptopic.text:
Before any checks for tag title length or content are carried out, the system will look to see if the word specified is included in this list.

If it is found, all other checks are bypassed and the word will be allowed, regardless of censorship, word length etc.

helptopic.title: Tag Minimum Length
helptopic.text: The minimum number of characters in a tag name. This can be between 1 and 100.

helptopic.title: Thumb Color
helptopic.text: This setting controls the color of thumbnails borders and labels. Valid entries are #000000 (black) to #FFFFFF (white).

helptopic.title: Terms of Service URL
helptopic.text: This is the URL to your terms of service, if you have them. If you don't you can leave this blank.

helptopic.title: User Infraction Discussion Forum
helptopic.text:
The User Infraction system can automatically create a discussion thread for each infraction.
The thread will be updated if the infraction is reversed.

helptopic.title: Require Infraction Message
helptopic.text: This option requires that the user sending an infraction include a message. The message format, either PM or Email, will depend on your forum's settings. If this option is disabled, the user may choose to not include a message with their infraction. The recipient will still receive a generic PM or Email in regards to their infraction.

helptopic.title: Allowed Fonts
helptopic.text: The list of allowed fonts for profile style customizations. Put each font on its own line.
