Please Note: If this setting is set as more than two, you will need to create the appropriate templates for this depth

helptopic.title: Depth of Forums - Forum Display
helptopic.text:
For example, if this is set to 2 and your forums are arranged like this:

parent
--child
----child's child

And you are currently viewing the "parent" forum then you will see the first two levels of the parent forum's subforums on the forumdisplay page:

--child
----child's child

helptopic.title: Depth of Sub-Forums
helptopic.text:
Use this option to display deep subforums as text links in the parent's forum description area.

For example, if your forums are setup like this:

parent
--child
----child's child

And your forum depth is set to 2 and this setting is set to 3 then you will see the first two forums displayed "fully" on the forum homepage while the level 3 "child's child" forum will appear within the "child" forum's description:

parent
--child
  child forum's description.
  Sub-Forums: child's child

helptopic.title: Show Forum Descriptions in Forum Listings
helptopic.text: Exactly what it says. Forum descriptions can be managed when you edit a specific forum here.

helptopic.title: Show Private Forums
helptopic.text:
Select 'No' here will hide private forums from users who are not allowed to access them. Users who do have permission to access them will have to log in before they can see these forums too.

Either of the yes options will allow users to see all forums that they don't have access to. The ability to see the forum's post count is controlled by the two yes options. If a forum is passworded, it is treated as a private forum until the user enters the valid password.

helptopic.title: Show Private Forums
helptopic.text:
A private forum is one that the current logged in user doesn't have access to. Disabling this option will hide private forums from users so they don't know what they're missing. ;)

If you enable this option then users will be able to see private forums but not access them.

helptopic.title: Show Lock Icons to Users
helptopic.text: Enable this option to display a lock icon on forums that the logged in user does not have access to.

helptopic.title: Last Thread Title Maximum Displayed Characters
helptopic.text: This setting is useful in preventing long thread titles from taking up too much space and stretching the table cells.

helptopic.title: Show Moderators
helptopic.text: You can disable this option to hide the moderator listing if, for example, you don't have any forum moderators, you don't want your users to see the list, or you just don't like the list taking up space.

helptopic.title: Show Thread Prefix in Last Post Column?
helptopic.text: If a thread has a prefix, this option controls whether the prefix is shown in the "Last Post" column in the forum listing. The prefix will always be shown in full along with the first {$vbulletin->options[lastthreadchars]} characters of the thread's title. This may increase the width of this column.

helptopic.title: Show Users Browsing Forums
helptopic.text:
Enabling this option shows a list of users that are browsing a particular forum on its forumdisplay.php page. Disable if you are concerned about performance.

There are 4 options:

Yes, Alphabetical to all visitors - This option will show an alphabetized list of users to guests and members.
Yes, Random to all visitors - This option will show a random order list of users to guests and members.
Yes, Alphabetical to members only - This option will show an alphabetized list of users to members only.
Yes, Random to members only - This option will show a random order list of users to members only.

helptopic.title: Maximum Displayed Threads Before Page Split
helptopic.text:
This is the maximum number of threads per page on forumdisplay.php.

Note: This number must be at least 1.

helptopic.title: Show Sticky Threads on All Pages
helptopic.text: Sticky threads are shown at the top of the forum thread listing. Enable this option to not only show sticky threads at the top of the listing, but also at the top of each page of threads.

helptopic.title: Highlight Threads in Which User Has Posted
helptopic.text: This feature is good for helping users keep track of their footsteps on busy forums. On less busy forums this feature is less useful.

helptopic.title: Hot Threads Enabled
helptopic.text: A thread is hot if it has at least X number of views and/or X number of replies. You can set the minimum number of views and replies below.

helptopic.title: Hot Threads Qualifying Views
helptopic.text: This is the minimum number of views required for a thread to be hot.

helptopic.title: Hot Threads Qualifying Posts
helptopic.text: This is the minimum number of posts required for a thread to be hot.

helptopic.title: Multi-Page Thread Links Enabled
helptopic.text: This option allows users to go from the forum thread listing directly to a specific page in a thread without having to view the first page of the thread first.

helptopic.title: Multi-Page Thread Maximum Links
helptopic.text: If a thread has 75 pages you probably don't want a link to each page in the forum's thread listing page. Use this option to limit the number of linked pages.

helptopic.title: Length of Thread Preview Text
helptopic.text: When you mouse-over a thread link a small hovering windows appears that shows the content of the first post in the thread. This setting is the maximum number of characters to show.

helptopic.title: Group Announcements
helptopic.text: When disabled, this option makes it so all announcements in a forum are shown as individual links (like threads) on the forumdisplay.php page. When enabled, this option combines all announcements one "thread" where each announcement is a "post."

helptopic.title: Show Users Browsing Threads
helptopic.text:
Enabling this option shows a list of users that are browsing a particular thread on its showthread.php page. Disable if you are concerned about performance.

There are 4 options:

Yes, Alphabetical to all visitors - This option will show an alphabetized list of users to guests and members.
Yes, Random to all visitors - This option will show a random order list of users to guests and members.
Yes, Alphabetical to members only - This option will show an alphabetized list of users to members only.
Yes, Random to members only - This option will show a random order list of users to members only.

helptopic.title: Maximum Displayed Posts Before Page Split
helptopic.text:
If a thread has 40 posts and this is set to 10, then the posts will be split over 4 pages. The user can set their own preference in their User CP if you give them the option (see "User-Settable Maximum Displayed Posts" below).

Note: This number must be at least 1.

helptopic.title: User-Settable Maximum Displayed Posts
helptopic.text: Here you can give your users the option to pick a different number of posts per page setting.

helptopic.title: Show Default Post Icon
helptopic.text: This post icon will be used on a post if the user doesn't choose one when posting.

helptopic.title: Number of Characters Before Wrapping Text
helptopic.text:
This is useful in preventing long words from stretching your forum layout.

Remember that, unless you are using preformatted text, X number of characters does not equal a specific width because different characters are different widths.

helptopic.title: Check Thread Rating
helptopic.text: It only makes sense not to present the user with a voting form if they have already voted, but you may wish to disable this option is you are concerned about performance.

helptopic.title: Check Thread Subscription
helptopic.text: It is convenient for the user to have this option enabled so they know when they have subscribed to a thread they are viewing, but you may wish to disable this option if you are concerned about performance.

helptopic.title: Show Similar Threads?
helptopic.text: This setting displays the similar thread box. The Automatic Similar Thread Search option does the actual work to find similar threads. Disable both options if you don't want this feature.

helptopic.title: Post Elements
helptopic.text:
Post elements are bits of information that can be displayed in the user information box in posts. Put a check next to the elements you want to be displayed.

Keep in mind that these post elements add processing time to thread pages. For example, to get a user's age vBulletin needs to do some math on the user's birth date and the current date in order to get an age out of it. This calculation is done for each post being displayed on a thread page. The additional overhead is small but is there nonetheless. If you are wanting to optimize your forum for speed then you should disable these post elements.

helptopic.title: Enable Threaded / Hybrid Mode
helptopic.text:
These modes are different ways to view posts within a thread. The user can set their own preference in their User CP.

Threaded mode shows a tree of links to individual posts within the thread. The tree shows the threading of the posts by indenting reply posts under the post they are in reply to. Only one post is viewable at a time.

Hybrid mode shows the threaded tree of post links as well as the linear expansion of those posts.

helptopic.title: Use Threaded Mode by Default
helptopic.text: Threaded mode shows a tree of links to individual posts within the thread. The tree shows the threading of the posts by indenting reply posts under the post they are in reply to. Only one post is viewable at a time.

helptopic.title: Threaded Mode: Posts Depth
helptopic.text:
Posts have relative depth in threaded mode. Take this threaded structure for example:

firstpost
-reply1
--re: reply1
---re: re: reply1
-reply2
--re: reply2

If you are viewing "firstpost" then both "reply1" and "reply2" are one level deep. If you are viewing "reply1" then "re: reply1" is one level deep and "re: re: reply1" is 2 levels deep.

helptopic.title: Threaded Mode: Maximum Cached Posts
helptopic.text: This is basically like the Maximum Displayed Posts Before Page Split setting in terms of thread load time. If this setting is set to 40 then vBulletin will load a maximum of 40 posts "in the background" so the page doesn't have to reload for each of those 40 posts.

helptopic.title: Threaded Mode: Trim Titles
helptopic.text:
This setting is in reference to the post titles that are associated with posts in the tree of posts that is displayed in a pane at the top of a thread when using hybrid or threaded mode.

Limiting the length of these post titles in the pane can help to make the post tree more readable and prevent it from running off of the pane and forcing a horizontal scroll bar. This becomes more of a problem with threads that have deep post trees.

helptopic.title: Private Messaging Enabled
helptopic.text: Private messaging allows users to send eachother personal messages using your forums, similar to email. Only the recipient of a private message can read it.

helptopic.title: Instant Messaging Support
helptopic.text: Enable this feature to alert users of new private messages while they are browsing your forums. This is not true instant messaging because the recipient of a private message must load a forum page to initiate the prompt.

helptopic.title: Maximum Characters Per Private Message
helptopic.text: Use this setting to limit the length of private messages.

helptopic.title: Floodcheck - Minimum Time Between Messages
helptopic.text: Enter the minimum number of seconds that must pass before a user can send another private message. Use this setting to prevent users from spamming your users with private messages.

helptopic.title: Default Messages Per-Page
helptopic.text:
For example, if a user has 100 private messages in their inbox and this is set to 50 then their private messages will be split over 2 pages.

Note: This number must be at least 1.

helptopic.title: Maximum Messages Per-Page
helptopic.text:
If a user has more private messages than are allowed on one page by this setting then they will be split across multiple pages.

Note: This number must be at least 1.

helptopic.title: Allow Message Icons for Private Messages
helptopic.text: Message icons are like smilies for private message titles. You can manage your message icons here.

helptopic.title: Allow BB Code in Private Messages
helptopic.text: BB code tags allow you to add certain html elements to messages (bold text, italic text, underlined text, lists, etc).

helptopic.title: Allow Smilies in Private Messages
helptopic.text: Enable this option to make smilie codes parse into their images. You can manage your smilies here.

helptopic.title: Allow [IMG] Code in Private Messages
helptopic.text:
[IMG] code allows users to display inline images, like this:

[IMG]http://www.domain.com/image.gif[/IMG]

helptopic.title: Allow HTML in Private Messages
helptopic.text: HTML code allows the user tremendous freedom in formatting their messages but also allows for malicious code to be inserted. Allowing HTML code is not recommended.

helptopic.title: Who's Online Enabled
helptopic.text:
Enable this option to allow viewing of the online.php page. This page shows a detailed list of currently active users, their locations, etc. This option only applies to online.php, not the "Currently Active Users" list on the forumhome page.

Reported locations do take forum permissions into consideration. For example, if a user in the online list is viewing a forum that the current logged in user doesn't have access to, then online.php will only report that they are viewing a forum and not give the name of the forum.

helptopic.title: Who's Online Refresh Period
helptopic.text: The who's online page auto refreshes itself. This setting determines how often it refreshes.

helptopic.title: Who's Online Display Guests
helptopic.text: A guest is a user that does not have a forum account or is not logged in.

helptopic.title: Who's Online Resolve IP Addresses
helptopic.text: Enabling this option will cause IP addresses on the who's online page to be resolved to hostnames. The IP viewing privilege is a group permission.

helptopic.title: Enable Spider Display
helptopic.text:
Spiders are programs that browse the internet and index web sites. Enabling this option will identify guests that are spiders according to the definitions in the settings below.

See this page in the vBulletin manual for information on how spiders are identified.

helptopic.title: Forum Archive Enabled
helptopic.text: Some search engines don't like "dynamic" pages with parameters in the URLs, like http://www.domain.com/index.php?parameter=value. The archive feature gives search engines "static" URLs from which to access your forum content.

helptopic.title: Display Simple View of Threads
helptopic.text:
Disabling this option will cause the thread links in the archive to link to the actual threads on the main forum (dynamic URLs and all). For example, instead of:

http://www.yoursite.com/forum/archive/index.php/t-1.html

...you will get:

http://www.yoursite.com/forum/showthread.php?t=1

helptopic.title: Forum Archive Threads Per Page
helptopic.text:
Enter the number of threads to display per page on the archive's thread listing pages.

Note: This number must be at least 1.

helptopic.title: Forum Archive Posts Per Page
helptopic.text:
Enter the number of posts to display per page in the archive's threads.

Note: This number must be at least 1.

helptopic.title: Control Panel Quick Statistics
helptopic.text: This setting is referring to the first page of the Admin CP, here.

helptopic.title: Control Panel Style Folder
helptopic.text: Select a style for the Admin and Moderator control panels.

helptopic.title: Timeout Admin Login
helptopic.text: Enabling this option will force admins to relogin if they are in the Admin CP for too long. This is more secure but potentially annoying.

helptopic.title: Enable Collapsing in Forum Manager?
helptopic.text: This setting is in reference to this page.

helptopic.title: User Editor Columns
helptopic.text: This setting is in reference to this page.

helptopic.title: Enable External Javascript
helptopic.text:
Enabling this option will allow people to receive a feed of the latest threads in specific forum(s). This may be included into a webpage to provide dynamic content.

The option refers specifically to a Javascript feed.

helptopic.title: Enable RSS Syndication
helptopic.text:
Enabling this option will allow people to receive a feed of the latest threads in specific forum(s). This may be included into a webpage or RSS reader to provide an automatically updated latest threads display.

The option refers specifically to an RSS feed.

helptopic.title: Enable XML Syndication
helptopic.text:
Enabling this option will allow people to receive a feed of the latest threads in specific forum(s). This may be included into a webpage or other program to provide an automatically updated latest threads display.

The option refers specifically to an XML feed.

helptopic.title: Thread Cutoff
helptopic.text: This option controls how far back, a scan for updated posts will undertake. The optimum setting it to choose a value that will generally result in 15 updated threads for guests. A busy forum will usually have 15 or more threads updated in an hour so the proper value for that forum would be to use 1. If a forum only receives a few updates a day, then increasing the value past 24 hours would be advisable.

helptopic.title: Log Database Errors to File
helptopic.text:
Enter a full server path. You might want to record database errors to a file if you chose not to have them emailed to you.

Any errors that occur when connecting to the database server will not be logged with this option. To receive notifications of these errors, you will have to have them emailed to you via the option in config.php.

helptopic.title: Log Failed Admin Control Panel Logins to File
helptopic.text: Enter a full server path. Recording failed Admin CP logins is useful for knowing when some one is trying to hack into your forums.

helptopic.title: Log PHP Warnings to a File
helptopic.text:
Enter a path here. For example, on a Windows server the path might be something like:

C:\logs\vbulletin.log

Or on a *nix server it might be something like:

/home/yoursite/logs/vbulletin.log

helptopic.title: Maximum File Size of Error Logs
helptopic.text: Enter a byte size. 1048576 bytes = 1 megabyte

helptopic.title: Disable Database Error Email Sending
helptopic.text: If you do not want to be notified about database errors by email then set this option to Yes. It is recommended that you keep at least one of the error reporting features enabled, whether that is email notification or a log file.

helptopic.title: Enable Plugin/Hook System
helptopic.text:
The plugin/hook systems allows for insertion of arbitrary code into specific locations in the PHP files without having to edit the files. This can be used to extend the functionality of vBulletin without hacking.

For troubleshooting purposes, you can turn off the plugin/hook system with this setting so you can eliminate your code as a possible cause.

helptopic.title: Allowed Font Sizes
helptopic.text: The list of allowed fonts size for profile style customizations. Put each font size on its own line. You may use any size that is valid in CSS.

helptopic.title: Allowed Border Widths
helptopic.text: The list of allowed border width sizes for profile style customizations. Put each border width size on its own line.

helptopic.title: Maximum Characters Per Visitor Message
helptopic.text:
Maximum characters to allow in a visitor message.

Set this to 0 for no limit.

helptopic.title: Default Messages Per-Page
helptopic.text:
This setting allows you to define the default number of messages displayed per-page in the user profiles.

Note: This number must be at least 1.

helptopic.title: Maximum Messages Per-Page
helptopic.text:
This setting allows you to limit the number of messages users may display per page in the user profiles.

Note: This number must be at least 1.

helptopic.title: Visitor Message Moderation
helptopic.text: When enabled, all new visitor messages are placed into moderation. This can also be enabled in usergroup permissions.

helptopic.title: Search Type
helptopic.text: Fulltext searching uses a search index that is constructed by MySQL itself, whereas vBulletin's own search feature uses its own index.

helptopic.title: Delete Indexes
helptopic.text:
When switching a forum to the fulltext search mode, you will want to consider emptying the indexes that the default search engine built. These indexes are not used by the fulltext search and consume a large portion of your database. You should be certain that you are going to permanently use the fulltext search before removing these indexes since, generally, it takes a lot of time and server load to rebuild these indexes. Another consideration is during any time that the fulltext option is enabled, these indexes will not be updated by any new posts. Using fulltext search for an extended period of time will leave these indexes stale and you may still wish to rebuild them.

You can also empty these indexes in the Update Counters section of Maintenance.

You may want to optimize the postindex and word tables afterwards by going to the Repair / Optimize Tables section of Maintenance.

helptopic.title: Email Message
helptopic.text:
This is the email message that the user will receive once their password has been reset.

The tokens {username} and {password} can be placed in the message and will be replaced by their values for each individual user.

You must enter the {password} token or an error will be shown.

helptopic.title: Email From
helptopic.text: Enter the email address that the sent emails will state that they are from.

helptopic.title: Email Subject
helptopic.text: The email subject that the user will see.

helptopic.title: Check Affected Accounts with Activity
helptopic.text: The time period selected here will determine which vulnerable accounts will have their password reset. You may wish to only perform a password reset on accounts that have been inactive for a certain period of time.

helptopic.title: Email to Send At Once
helptopic.text: This is the number of messages to be sent in a batch. Unless you run your own server, it is recommended this is set to 100 or less. Even if you do run your own server, unless it is not very busy, you should keep this relatively low.

helptopic.title: About Phrases
helptopic.text:
Related General Help Topics:
Languages
Phrases

Phrases:
vBulletin's phrase system is used to make the templates language-independent. Everywhere there would normally be a hard coded, language-specific phrase there is a variable that parses to the value of the phrase for the language in which the user is viewing your forums. Some phrases will be represented in the templates like this:

$vbphrase[phrase_identifier]

While other phrases that have variables in them will be represented like this:

<phrase 1="value for variable 1" 2="value for variable 2">$vbphrase[phrase_identifier]</phrase>

In the above example, the variables {1} and {2} in the phrase "phrase_identifier" will be replaced with the values you see defined in the template.

helptopic.title: Adding a new Phrase
helptopic.text: On this screen you can add a new phrase for use in the templates. The phrase will be called like this from the templates: $vbphrase[variablename] where variablename is a brief description of what the phrase is.

helptopic.title: Phrase Type
helptopic.text: The phrase type is a way of categorizing your phrases to make it easier to find them later. This consists of several built-in types, as well as any you have added. Select what type your new phrase is from the list.

helptopic.title: Variable Name
helptopic.text:
The variable name is how you will refer to your phrase from the templates. It should not contain any spaces or special characters - meaning, only use A-Z, a-z, 0-9, -, and _ (underscore) in the name.

To call the phrase from the templates, use
$vbphrase[variablename]
where variablename is what you put in this box.

helptopic.title: Text to insert
helptopic.text: This is the default text for the phrase. This will not be shown to users; only the "translated" versions will be shown. You can optionally enter a translation for each language you have installed. If you do not enter a translation for a language, the text from this field will be shown for that language. You can always add a translation for any language at a later date.

helptopic.title: Delete Phrase
helptopic.text: This page allows you to delete this phrase. Click the "Yes" button below to delete this phrase. Deleting this phrase will also delete any translated versions of it in other languages. This action cannot be undone.

helptopic.title: Editing a Phrase
helptopic.text: On this screen you can edit an existing phrase for use in the templates. You cannot change the variablename or text to insert; you can only change the translations of the phrase.

helptopic.title: Language
helptopic.text: Select MASTER LANGUAGE if you want this phrase to be part of the MASTER LANGUAGE of vBulletin, otherwise select "Custom Language".

helptopic.title: Find Orphan Phrases
helptopic.text:
This page shows you a list of all orphan phrases. An orphan phrase is a phrase that does not belong to any language. For each language you have installed, there will be a column with a series of checkmarks and "x"'s to indicate whether the phrase is or isn't translated into that language, respectively.

For each orphan phrase you are given the option to keep it or not. Select the "Keep" or "Delete" radio button on the right. If you want to keep all or delete all orphan phrases then click the appropriate button at the top. Click the "Continue" button at the bottom to perform the selected action and proceed to the next orphan phrase.

helptopic.title: Find Updated Phrases
helptopic.text: vBulletin's default phrases are sometimes updated during upgrades. This page shows you what customized phrases may need to be recustomized as a result of the default phrases changing.

helptopic.title: Manage Orphan Phrases
helptopic.text: These orphan phrases need parents. Below is a list of all translations for each orphan phrase. You need to choose one translation to be default... the orphan phrase will then be adopted by that parent language.

helptopic.title: Modifying Phrases
helptopic.text:
On this screen you can see all existing phrases. For each language you have installed, there will be a column with a series of checkmarks and "x"'s to indicate whether the phrase is or isn't translated into that language, respectively.

Clicking 'Edit' to the extreme right of any phrase allows you to modify, add, or remove translations for that phrase. If this is a custom phrase, there will be a link to Delete it.

helptopic.title: Quickref
helptopic.text: This window allows you to quickly view all phrases for all languages. Select a language and phrase category in the menus at the bottom and click the "View" button. To view each phrase's variable name and value just click on the phrase name in the scroll box on the left.

helptopic.title: Searching Phrases
helptopic.text: On this screen you can search for a specific phrase. This searches all languages for the text you specify.

helptopic.title: Find phrases containing text
helptopic.text: This is the text you want to search for.

helptopic.title: Search in Language
helptopic.text: Select the language in which you want to search.

helptopic.title: Search for text in
helptopic.text: If you only want to search the actual text of the phrase, select 'Phrase text only'. If you only want to search the variable name (e.g. in $vbphrase[august], august is the variable name) select 'Variable name only'. If you want to search in both places, select 'Phrase text and variable name'.

helptopic.title: Use case-sensitive search
helptopic.text: If this is set to Yes, the search being performed will be done in a case-sensitive manner, meaning exactly what you type will be searched for.

helptopic.title: Replace with Text
helptopic.text: The search text will be replaced with this text.

helptopic.title: Allow Overwrite
helptopic.text:
This controls whether the uploaded product may overwrite an existing, installed product to prevent you from accidentally reinstalling an existing product.

If you are upgrading an existing product, simply set this to yes. Your customized options, templates, and phrases will not be altered.

helptopic.title: Product ID
helptopic.text: This is the unique identifier for your product. It may only contain a-z, A-Z, 0-9, and _ (underscore). This is used to associate all related data with your product. It may not be changed after the product is created.

helptopic.title: Product Title
helptopic.text: This is the name of your product. It is shown to users when they view their list of currently installed products.

helptopic.title: Version
helptopic.text:
This page may display two version numbers.

Product Version
This is the current version of your product. It is important to increment this when you make changes to your product so install codes can be managed properly and your users will know when there is a newer version out.

Install/Uninstall Code Version
This is the version the install/uninstall code is associated with. When you release a product that requires code to be run during installation or uninstallation, you should associate it with the first version of the product that requires the code.

helptopic.title: Product Description
helptopic.text: This is simply a description of the product. It is shown to the user when viewing the list of installed products.

helptopic.title: Product URL
helptopic.text: This is the URL that users will go to to receive information about your product. If provided, the product's name will be linked to this URL in the installed product list.

helptopic.title: Version Check URL
helptopic.text:
This allows you to specify a URL that can be called to check for the latest version of your product. Any URL may be specified, but it must return data in a specific format.

For the version check to function properly, data returned from the specified URL should be in the format of: 
<version productid="x">1.2.3</version>
x should be replaced with the ID of the product that the version applies to. 1.2.3 should be replaced with the latest version of the product.

Note: A POST request will be made to the server. Some configurations deny this for static files so you may need to use PHP to serve the data.

helptopic.title: Dependency Type
helptopic.text:
The product dependency system allows you to specify specific requirements for your product. If a user does not meet one or more of your requirements, he/she will not be able to install your product.

This option controls what the required item is. You may select from:
  1. PHP Version
  2. MySQL Version
  3. vBulletin Version
  4. Product ID - this option allows you to specify the ID of another product that must be installed and enabled before this product can be installed
Using the Compatibility Starts With Version and Incompatible With Version options, you may specify a range of versions that are compatible with your product.

Note:. If you specify multiple entries for a specific dependency type, the person installing your product must only meet one dependency per type. For example, if you require PHP to be less than 4.2.0 and PHP to be greater than or equal to 4.3.0, as long as the user meets one of those two requirements, the install will continue.

helptopic.title: Incompatible With Version
helptopic.text:
This is the first incompatible version. All versions newer than this are also incompatible. If you wish to only require a minimum version, you may leave this field blank.

This version is not considered compatible. For example, if you specify that your product is incompatible with PHP 5.0.0, a user with PHP 5.0.0 Beta 1 will be able to install your product, while a user with PHP 5.0.0 or 5.0.1 would not.

helptopic.title: Compatibility Starts With Version
helptopic.text:
This controls the minimum compatible version. You may leave this blank if you wish to have no minimum version.

This version is included in the compatibility. For example, if you require PHP 5.0.0, 5.0.0 will qualify. However, 5.0.0 Beta 1 will not.

helptopic.title: Install Code
helptopic.text:
This is code that will be executed when a user installs your product.

It will only be executed if the version the code is associated with has not been installed. For example, if you select a version of 1.0, when a user first installs your product, this install code will run. If he/she later upgrades from 1.0 to 1.1, install code associated with 1.0 will not run.

When multiple install codes must be run (such as if you have install codes for 1.0 and 1.1 and the user does not have any version of your product installed), they will be executed in ascending version order. That is, 1.0 code will execute before 1.1 code.

helptopic.title: Uninstall Code
helptopic.text: This code will be executed when a user uninstalls your product. Code will be executed from newest version to oldest version. For example, if there is uninstall code associated with versions 1.0 and 1.1, the 1.1 code will run before the 1.0 code.

helptopic.title: Prefix ID
helptopic.text: This is the unique identifier for this prefix. Only one prefix can have this value and the value may only contain A-Z, a-z, 0-9, and _ (underscores) only.

helptopic.title: Prefix Set
helptopic.text:
The set this prefix is to be placed in. This prefix will only be selectable in forums that have this set enabled.

If you change this set, threads that can no longer use this prefix will have it removed!

helptopic.title: Title (Plain Text)
helptopic.text:
This is the title of the prefix, using no special markup. This will be shown in the prefix list menu, when the thread title is shown in the navigation bar, or when the thread title is used in an email.

This title will be placed before the thread title with a space only. You will probably want to include some sort of delimiter character to make it more obvious that the prefix is being used. For example, if you use the prefix "For Sale", you may wish to enter "For Sale:" or "[For Sale]" here.

helptopic.title: Title (Rich Text)
helptopic.text:
This is also the title of the prefix, but you may use HTML to add additional markup to the title. For example, you could turn a prefix red and bold by using: <span style="color: red"><b>For Sale</b></span> This would look like this: For Sale.

This version of the prefix will be shown in a list of threads and within the thread itself.

helptopic.title: Display Order
helptopic.text: The sort order for this prefix. Lower values will be displayed first within the selected prefix set.

helptopic.title: Prefix Set ID
helptopic.text: This is the unique identifier for this prefix set. Only one set can have this value and the value may only contain A-Z, a-z, 0-9, and _ (underscores) only.

helptopic.title: Title
helptopic.text: This is the title of this prefix set. You should not use any special HTML markup.

helptopic.title: Use Prefix Set in These Forums
helptopic.text: Prefix sets must be attached to forums before they can be used. Select the forum or forums this prefix set will be available in using this field. Once you do this, when a user creates a new thread in a selected forum, he or she will be able to select a prefix from this set.

helptopic.title: Display Order
helptopic.text:
The sorting order for sets. Sets with lower values will be shown before sets with higher values.

Note that the display order setting for individual prefixes only controls their order within the set.

helptopic.title: Thread Prefixes Overview
helptopic.text:
Thread prefixes are a structured way to specify how certain topics are discussed within a forum. You create prefix sets which contain many prefixes and can be tied to any number of forums.

When a user creates a thread, he or she will have the option of specifying a prefix to the thread title. This prefix can be used to filter threads within the forum or searched on.

For example, you may wish to use prefixes in a marketplace forum, where people post "Wanted" and "For Sale" entries. Alternatively, if you have multiple products and only one announcement forum, you could have prefix threads in that forum depending on the product they relate to.

helptopic.title: About User Profile Fields
helptopic.text:
User Profile Fields:
User profile fields have two main applications. First, they can be used to hold information about your users. For example, a default vBulletin profile field is the "Location" field where a user can enter their location. Second, profile fields can be used as forum options to drive conditionals in your templates. This application is explained in this help topic.

There are different types of profile fields that can be selected when creating a new profile field on the Add New User Profile Field page. Below are examples of each kind of profile field:

Single-line Text Box (input): In HTML, this is
<input type="text" name="" />
which equates to this:


Multi-line Text Box (textarea): In HTML, this is
<textarea name=""></textarea>
which equates to this:


Single-selection Radio Buttons (radio): In HTML, this is
<input type="radio" name="a" /> Option 1
<input type="radio" name="a" /> Option 2
which equates to this:
Option 1
Option 2

Single-selection Menu (select): In HTML, this is
<select name="sel">
<option value="1">Option 1<option>
<option value="2">Option 2<option>
</select>
which equates to this:


Multiple-selection Menu (select multiple): In HTML, this is
<select name="sel" multiple="multiple" size="3">
<option value="1">Option 1</option>
<option value="2">Option 2</option>
<option value="3">Option 3</option>
<option value="4">Option 4</option>
<option value="5">Option 5</option>
</select>
which equates to this:


Multiple selection Checkboxes (checkbox): In HTML, this is
<input type="checkbox" name="name" value="1" /> Option 1
<input type="checkbox" name="name" value="2" /> Option 2
which equates to this:
Option 1
Option 2

helptopic.title: Adding a User Profile Field
helptopic.text: On this screen you can add a user profile field. A user profile field is a field that the users fill in during registration (or afterwards on their Edit Profile page) that can then be displayed in various places.

helptopic.title: Profile Field Type
helptopic.text: This option determines what kind of control will be used to enter the value of the field.

helptopic.title: Title
helptopic.text: This is the title of the profile field as displayed to your users and in the admin control panel. It can be up to 50 characters long.

helptopic.title: Description
helptopic.text: This is the description of the field as shown to your users. You should describe here what the field is intended for, and if it is required field or not, and/or if it is private from other users or not.

helptopic.title: Profile Field Category
helptopic.text:
It is possible to group custom user profile fields into categories so that they can be logically grouped. The primary purpose of doing this is to allow different categories to be shown in different tabs or blocks on a user's profile page (in addition to being shown in the 'About Me' tab).

For further information, see the help entry for the profile field category manager.

helptopic.title: Multiple Choice Fields
helptopic.text:
Select Fields
In this box, put each value that should appear as an option. Make sure to press Enter after each option or it will not work correctly!

Radio Fields
In this box, put each value that should appear as a radio button. Make sure to press Enter after each option or it will not work correctly!

Checkbox Fields
In this box, put each value that should appear as a checkbox. Make sure to press Enter after each option or it will not work correctly!

helptopic.title: Maximum Input Length
helptopic.text:
Maximum Input (Input, Textarea only)
This setting is how many characters a user is allowed to enter into this field.

Maximum Input (for Optional Field, Select, Radio only)
This setting is how many characters a user may enter into the optional field.

helptopic.title: Field Length & Limit Boxes
helptopic.text:
Field Length (Input, Textarea only)
This is how many characters long the input should appear on the forms. This should be less than or equal to the maximum number of characters allowed to be entered into this field.

Field Length (for Optional Field, Select, Radio only)
This setting is how many characters long the input field should appear as on the form. It is recommended that you set this to be equal to or less than the maximum number of characters the user may enter as set above.

Limit Boxes (Select Multiple only)
This is how many options the user may choose. Set to 0 to allow the user to select all options.

Limit Boxes (Checkbox only)
This setting is how many checkboxes the user may check total for this field. Enter 0 to allow them to select all checkboxes.

helptopic.title: Profile Field Type
helptopic.text: Select a field type for this profile field. Please see the General Topics for examples of each type of profile field.

helptopic.title: Field Height (Textarea only)
helptopic.text:
This is how many rows high the input should be on the forms. It is recommend that you set this to at least 2 for user sanity reasons.
This only applies to Textarea type fields

helptopic.title: Set Default?
helptopic.text:
Select Fields
If you wish to have the first option set as the default choice for this field, set this to Yes. Otherwise, a blank line will be the default. This is useful to force users to select an option at registration if this is a required field.

Radio Fields
If this is set to Yes, the first radio button will be preselected for the user. Otherwise, none will be selected. This is useful if you wish to force a user to select one if this field is required.

helptopic.title: Items Per Line (Radio, Checkbox only)
helptopic.text: This setting is how many controls to display per line on forms. Set this to 0 to show all controls on one line.

helptopic.title: Box Height (Select Multiple only)
helptopic.text: This setting is how tall the box should be. If you have 12 options and want 3 of them displayed without the user having to use the scrollbar, set this to 3. It is recommended that you set this to at least 3 for user sanity reasons.

helptopic.title: Display Order
helptopic.text: This sets the order in which fields are displayed. The default is to add it to the end of your current fields. Display order starts at 1 and can be any whole positive number (e.g. don't use decimals or fractions).

helptopic.title: Field Required?
helptopic.text:
Yes, at registration and profile updating - User will be required to complete this field at registration and when updating their profile.

Yes, always - User will be required to complete this field at registration. Enabling this setting will force all users to complete it before they can continue using your forum. This applies only if the field is shown on the "Edit Your Details" page.

No - Completion of this field is optional.

No, but display at registration - Completion of this field is optional but it will appear at registration.

helptopic.title: Field Editable by User?
helptopic.text:
Yes - User may edit this field at any time.

No - User may never edit this field.

Only at registration - User may only edit this field at registration or if it is set to be required and it is blank.

helptopic.title: Private Field
helptopic.text: If this is set to Yes, this field can be filled in by the user but will only be viewable to those with the proper usergroup permission.

helptopic.title: Field searchable on member's list
helptopic.text: If this is set to No, users will not be able to search using this field on the Member's List Advanced Search. If this field is set to Private than only those users with the proper usergroup permission will be able to search on it.

helptopic.title: Show on member's list?
helptopic.text: If this is set to Yes, this field will be displayed on the Member's List for each user. If you set this field as Private, only those with the proper usergroup permission will be able to see this field on the Member's List.

helptopic.title: Allow Additional Field? (Select, Radio only)
helptopic.text: If this is set to Yes, the user will be allowed to fill in a text input field as an alternative to the options you have given for this field.

helptopic.title: Regular Expression (Select, Input, Radio, Textarea only)
helptopic.text:
You may require this field's contents to match a PCRE-type regular expression. For example, you could have a field that is for the user's ICQ number. Since ICQ numbers consist of only numerals, you could write a regular expression to check for non-numerals.

Example: (Do not start or end the expression with an escape character)

^[0-9]{7,8}$

If you want to allow an empty response to be given, you need to account for it within the regex:

^[0-9]{7,8}$|^$

See PHP.net for more information on regular expressions.

helptopic.title: Which page displays this option?
helptopic.text:
This controls what page the profile field is displayed on. Most likely you want to leave this on "Edit Your Details" but if you wish to create your own user options that can be manipulated via template conditionals then select "Options". This field will then appear on the "Options" page of the User CP. Also, this field will not appear when viewing a user's profile.

As mentioned, you can use template conditionals to add additional options for your users. For example, you can make this profile field a "one option" check box field under one of the "Options" categories. You can then use the field as a conditional to display something in your postbit template. If the "Name" of this profile field is field1 then you can use this code in your postbit template:

<if condition="$post['field1']">
code to display if the user has checked the profile field
</if>

The green code in the middle will only be displayed if the user has checked the profile field in their options.

helptopic.title: Edit Profile Field
helptopic.text: On this screen you can edit this user profile field. A user profile field is a field that the users fill in during registration (or afterwards on their Edit Profile page) that can then be displayed in various places.

helptopic.title: User Profile Field Category Editor
helptopic.text: It is possible to group custom user profile fields into categories so that they can be logically grouped. The primary purpose of doing this is to allow different categories to be shown in different tabs or blocks on a user's profile page (in addition to being shown in the 'About Me' tab).

helptopic.title: Allow User Privacy Options
helptopic.text: This option controls whether the category will appear in the 'Customize Profile' page, allowing users to select whether to hide or display the category's profile block to other users.

helptopic.title: Title
helptopic.text: Enter the title of the profile field category, as you would like it to be seen by your visitors. Do not use raw HTML.

helptopic.title: Description
helptopic.text: Enter a description of the profile field category. This information will appear in small text below the title of the category in the 'About Me' tab of users' profile pages.

helptopic.title: Location on Profile Page
helptopic.text:
Use this control to specify whereabouts on a users' profile pages you would like this profile field category to appear.

There are several options, some of which will cause the information to appear as a tab, and other will display the information as a block in the column next to the tabs.

helptopic.title: Display Order
helptopic.text: This option controls where the category will appear relative to other categories when listed. A category with a higher display order number will appear after or below a lower number.

helptopic.title: User Profile Field Manager
helptopic.text:
On this page you can manage your user profile fields. User profile fields are used to hold information and preferences about your users.

Click the [Edit] link to edit the settings of the corresponding profile field. Click the [Delete] link to do exactly that (this will lose information if users have information in the field!).

User profile fields can be displayed in posts next to the author's name. If you want to display a profile field in posts then you need to edit your postbit or postbit_legacy template (depending on which one you use as is indicated by the "Use Legacy (Vertical) Postbit Template" option in your vBulletin options) and add $post[fieldX] where X is the field ID of the profile field as shown under the "Name" column on this page.

Below is a list of existing profile fields. The "Title / Profile Field Type" column tells you the name and type of the profile field. Please see the General Topics for examples of each type of profile field.

The "Options" column tells you which options are enabled for the corresponding profile field. Profile fields can be required, editable, private, searchable, and shown on the member list - or not.

The "Name" column tells you the field number of the corresponding profile field. You can use a profile field's field number to make it show in user posts (see above).

The "Display Order" column tells you the display order of the corresponding profile field. Display orders are used to order profile fields on the various pages of the User CP on which they can be displayed. You can change display orders on this page by editing the display order fields and clicking the "Save Display Order" button.

helptopic.title: Delete Profile Field
helptopic.text: This is a confirmation that you want to delete this profile field. Deleting this profile field will lose information if your users have information in this field. Click the "Yes" button below to perform the deletion. This action cannot be undone.

helptopic.title: About Execute SQL Query
helptopic.text:
Related General Help Topics:
Database Backup
Repair / Optimize
Update Counters
Diagnostics
Execute SQL Query

Execute SQL Query:
This page can be used to run queries on your forum database. This can be useful for mass-updating records in your database. You should always backup your database before querying it. Any valid MySQL query can be run here. See mysql.com for more information.

helptopic.title: Execute SQL Query
helptopic.text: This feature lets you run queries on your vBulletin database. You should backup your database before querying it.

helptopic.title: Automatic Query
helptopic.text: These are predefined queries for managing user settings. Select the query you want to run and click the "Continue" button to execute it.

helptopic.title: Manual Query
helptopic.text: Here you can manually type in the query you want to run. Only one query can be run at a time. Once a query is executed it can not be reversed.

helptopic.title: Results to Show Per Page
helptopic.text: Queries return results after they are executed. Here you can specify the number of returned results to show per page.

helptopic.title: About User Ranks
helptopic.text:
User Ranks:
Users ranks are rank insignia based on post count and usergroup that are displayed next to names in posts. User ranks work very similar to user titles, the main difference being that user titles are for all usergroups while user ranks can be created for specific usergroups. In this way you can create different rank insignia for different usergroups. User ranks appear next to names in posts.

helptopic.title: Add New User Rank
helptopic.text: Here you can add a new user rank. Please see the individual help topics below if you have questions about the options.

helptopic.title: Number of times to repeat rank
helptopic.text:
This is the number of times that this rank image or text will be repeated when it is displayed next to a user's name in their posts.

For example, if you specify a rank text of "Captain" and this setting is set to 2, then the user's rank will be shown as "CaptainCaptain".

helptopic.title: Minimum Posts
helptopic.text: This is the minimum number of posts required for a user to obtain this rank. When a user in the specified usergroup reaches this many posts then they will be given this rank.

helptopic.title: Usergroup
helptopic.text:
This is the usergroup to which this rank applies. The users to whom is applied depends on the value of the "Display Type" setting. If you select "Always", all users with this usergroup in his/her primary or secondary groups will receive this rank. If you select "If Displaygroup = This Group", then only users that identify themselves as this group will receive this rank.

Select "All Usergroups" to have this rank apply to everyone regardless of their usergroup.

helptopic.title: User Rank File Path
helptopic.text:
Enter a file path to an image for this rank. The path should be relative to your main forum directory. For example, if the image you want for this rank is named rank.gif and you upload it to the images directory within your forum directory then you would enter: images/rank.gif

Alternately, you can leave this field blank and fill in the next one instead.

helptopic.title: Rank Text
helptopic.text:
If you want to display text for this rank instead of an image, then leave the previous field blank and fill in this field instead. You can use HTML code in this field.

Some HTML tags you might want to use here include:

<b>rank</b> = rank
<i>rank</i> = rank
<u>rank</u> = rank
<font color="red">rank</font> = rank
<font size="4">rank</font> = rank

helptopic.title: Stack Rank
helptopic.text: If chosen, the rank will be stacked when appearing with other ranks. Otherwise the rank will be placed to the left of other ranks. In HTML terms, this option controls whether or not a <br /> tag is inserted before the rank.

helptopic.title: Display Type
helptopic.text:
Always: This rank will always be displayed if a member has this rank's usergroup as their primary or one of their secondary groups.

If Displaygroup = This Group: This rank will only be displayed if a member's displaygroup is equal to this rank's usergroup.

helptopic.title: Edit User Rank
helptopic.text: Here you can edit this user rank. Please see the individual help topics below if you have questions about the options.

helptopic.title: User Rank Manager
helptopic.text:
This is the user rank manager. Here you can manage ranks based on post count for one or all usergroups. Ranks can be represented by images or text (HTML is allowed).

Below is a list of all existing ranks (if any). The ranks below are grouped by the usergroups to which they apply. The "User Rank" column shows the image or text that is granted to the user when they qualify for the corresponding rank. The "Minimum Posts" column shows you the post count that is needed to acquire the corresponding rank.

Click the [Edit] link to the right of a rank to change its target usergroup, minimum required post count, and the image / text that is the rank. Click the [Delete] link to delete the rank completely.

helptopic.title: Delete Rank
helptopic.text: This is a confirmation that you want to delete this rank. Click the "Yes" button below to perform the deletion.

helptopic.title: About Repair / Optimize
helptopic.text:
Related General Help Topics:
Database Backup
Repair / Optimize
Update Counters
Diagnostics
Execute SQL Query

Repair / Optimize:
This script can be used to repair / optimize your database. If you are getting database errors caused by corruption then running this script might fix them. An alternative to repairing your database with this script is to run a REPAIR TABLE query from the mysql prompt through a telnet / SSH connection to your server (if you have access).

You can also use this script to optimize your tables. You should optimize your database tables if you have recently pruned a large number of threads, posts, users, etc. Optimizing helps you reclaim unused space which can reduce the size of your database.

helptopic.title: Repair / Optimize Tables
helptopic.text: Select the tables below and then the appropriate action to repair your tables if they have been corrupted or optimize to improve speed.

helptopic.title: Optimize Tables
helptopic.text: Database tables should be optimized if you have deleted a large part of a table or if you have made many changes to a table with variable-length rows (tables that have VARCHAR, BLOB, or TEXT columns). Optimizing helps you reclaim unused space which can reduce the size of your database.

helptopic.title: Repair Tables
helptopic.text: Repairs the selected database tables if errors are found.

helptopic.title: About Replacement Variables
helptopic.text:
Related General Help Topics:
Styles & Templates
Common Templates, StyleVars, and CSS
Replacement Variables

Replacement Variables:
Replacement variables are raw string replacements for your templates that are case-insensitive.

For example, if you create a replacement variable using the variable string "vbulletin" and the replacement string "is cool", then these template strings will be parsed into the following strings upon loading a forum page:

Template string: Powered by vBulletin
Parsed string: Powered by is cool

Template string: vBULLetin3
Parsed string: is cool3

You can use replacement variables the same way vBulletin uses stylevars (see "Common Templates, StyleVars, and CSS" link above). If you use the same string in several templates then you can create a replacement variable for it. You can use the replacement variable in the templates and set its value in this Replacement Variable Manager. If you need to change the value of the string then you can edit the replacement variable which will change its value in every template where the variable occurs.

helptopic.title: Add New Replacement Variable
helptopic.text:
Here you can add a new replacement variable. Replacement variables are useful in representing commonly used values in templates. For example, the images directory path is used in many vBulletin templates and so it is represented by a replacement variable. The images directory replacement variable can be edited to change the images path in every template.

First you need to select a style to which you want this replacement variable to belong. The "Search for Text" field is the variable you will use in the templates. The "Replace with Text" field is the value that will be substituted in for the replacement variable everywhere it is used.

helptopic.title: Style
helptopic.text: Select a style to which you want this replacement variable to belong.

helptopic.title: Search for Text
helptopic.text: This field is the variable that is used in the templates. The value in the "Replace with Text" field will be substituted in for this variable everywhere it is used.

helptopic.title: Replace with Text
helptopic.text: This field is the value that will be substituted in for this replacement variable everywhere it is used.

helptopic.title: Edit Replacement Variable
helptopic.text:
Here you can edit this replacement variable. Replacement variables are useful in representing commonly used values in templates. For example, the images directory path is used in many vBulletin templates and so it is represented by a replacement variable. The images directory replacement variable can be edited to change the images path in every template.

The "Search for Text" field is the variable that is used in the templates. The "Replace with Text" field is the value that is substituted in for the replacement variable everywhere it is used.

helptopic.title: Replacement Variable Manager
helptopic.text: This page shows you replacement variables for all styles. Replacement variables can be used in templates. When a forum page is loaded all of the replacement variables in its templates are parsed into their replacement values.

helptopic.title: Delete Replacement Variable
helptopic.text: This page allows you to delete this replacement variable. Click the "Yes" button below to perform the deletion. If this style has any children then they will also lose access to this replacement variable when it is deleted. This action cannot be undone!

helptopic.title: About Viewing Permissions
helptopic.text:
Related General Help Topics:
Forums
Forum Permissions
Moderators
Viewing Permissions

Viewing Permissions:
vBulletin's permission system is very powerful and flexible, but it can be complex to work with if you are inexperienced with vBulletin. Sometimes it is hard to know if you have permissions setup correctly. This page allows you to confirm correct permissions for a forum for a usergroup.

For a detailed explanation about usergroups and forum permissions, see the general help topic for Usergroups.

helptopic.title: View Forum Permissions
helptopic.text:
This page allows you to view the forum permissions for a usergroup for a specific forum. This can be useful in confirming correct permissions when permission inheritance and other complexities are involved.

First select a forum and usergroup for which you want to view permissions. Then put a check next to the permissions you want to view. Click "Find" to view the permissions.

helptopic.title: Forum
helptopic.text: Select a forum for which you want to view permissions.

helptopic.title: Usergroup
helptopic.text: Select a usergroup for which you want to view permissions for the selected forum.

helptopic.title: Permissions
helptopic.text: Below is a report showing the forum permissions for the forum and group you selected.

helptopic.title: View User
helptopic.text: Here you can view this user's permissions at the forum level.

helptopic.title: Reset Last Checked Time
helptopic.text: If this box is checked when the feed is saved, the last run time will be set so that the feed will be checked the next time the RSS Poster scheduled task is run, regardless of the TTL setting for the feed.

helptopic.title: Feed is Enabled
helptopic.text:
If this option is set to 'No', the feed will not be checked whenever the scheduled task is run.

Use this to temporarily disable a feed without deleting it.

helptopic.title: Title
helptopic.text: This should contain some text that describes the source of the feed for easy identification in the RSS Feed Manager.

helptopic.title: URL of Feed
helptopic.text:
This box should contain the complete URL of the feed to be read.

For example: http://www.vbulletin.com/forum/external.php?type=RSS2&forumids=1

helptopic.title: Check Feed Every...
helptopic.text: While the RSS Poster scheduled task runs every ten minutes, you can limit the frequency at which this feed is checked.

helptopic.title: Maximum Items to Fetch
helptopic.text:
Some feeds may list many items. If you would like to limit the number of items to read from a feed, enter a maximum number in this box.

For example, if you specify '5', any items over this number will be ignored.

Enter '0' to fetch all items.

helptopic.title: Search Items for Words
helptopic.text:
You may specify a list of words and phrases here with which to search the items from an RSS feed.

Separate each word or phrase with a space or a new line.

Phrases that contain spaces may be used by surrounding them with double quotes.

If any of the words or phrases listed here are contained within the title (or the title and description if 'Search Item Body' is checked) then the item will be posted. If not, the item will be ignored.

If you select 'Match All Words' then only items that contain all of the terms and phrases will be posted.

helptopic.title: User Name
helptopic.text:
Enter the user name of the user as whom items from the feed will be posted.

The user name must exist, though you could add a new user specifically for the purpose of posting RSS items.

helptopic.title: Forum
helptopic.text:
Specify here the forum into which you would like items from this RSS feed to be posted.

Ensure that the forum can contain posts (is not a category) when selecting.

helptopic.title: Allow Smilies
helptopic.text: If this item is set to 'Yes', any smilie codes found in the RSS feed items will be parsed into their corresponding smilie images.

helptopic.title: Display Signature
helptopic.text: Select 'Yes' if you would like the signature of the user specified above to be shown on RSS feed items posted by that user.

helptopic.title: Convert HTML to BB Code
helptopic.text: When this option is enabled any HTML found within the RSS feed item will be converted to BB code prior to posting, it is not retroactive so when enabled only new posts will have this conversion.

helptopic.title: Title Template
helptopic.text:
The title template controls how thread or announcement titles will appear when items are posted.

You may use any node from the feed XML by entering {feed:x} into the template, where 'x' corresponds to:
  • title
  • description
  • link
  • id
  • date
  • enclosure_href
  • content:encoded.

For the most part, you will use {feed:title} to show the title for the current feed item.

helptopic.title: Body Template
helptopic.text:
The body template controls the main text of threads or announcements for feed items.

In the same way as can be done with the Title Template, you may use selected nodes from the feed XML by specifying {feed:x}.
Valid values for x include:
  • title
  • description
  • link
  • id
  • date
  • enclosure_href
  • content:encoded.

The main replacements to include in this template is the <description> and <link> nodes, which can be referenced with {feed:description} and {feed:link}.

For example: 
[b][i]My RSS Feed[/i] Has Just Posted the Following:[/b]

{feed:description}

[url="{feed:link}"]Click here to view the article.[/url]

helptopic.title: Post Items as Threads or Announcements
helptopic.text:
Items found in RSS feeds can be posted either as new threads or as announcements.

Different options apply to each post type and are detailed below.

Remember that users can not reply to announcements, so if you want discussion of RSS items it's probably best to post items as threads.

helptopic.title: Prefix
helptopic.text: You may use this option to apply a prefix to automatically posted threads. However, this prefix must be allowed in the destination forum. To ensure this is the case, note the prefix set of the prefix you wish to use. Go into the "Forum Manager", edit the destination forum for this RSS feed, and ensure that the correct prefix set (or sets) are selected.

helptopic.title: Post Icons
helptopic.text: Allows you to pick an icon for threads posted by this RSS feed.

helptopic.title: Make Thread Sticky
helptopic.text: Select this option if you would like threads posted from this feed to be made into sticky threads, which remain at the top of the forumdisplay list.

helptopic.title: Moderate Thread
helptopic.text: If you would like your moderation staff to be able to review each item posted from this RSS feed before it appears on your forums, set this option to 'Yes'.

helptopic.title: Thread Action Delay
helptopic.text:
If items are posted as threads, you may specify a delay in hours here and have the system then perform an action on the thread.

For example, you could specify a delay of 6 hours, then have the system close threads posted by this RSS feed after that delay.

A setting of '0' disables the thread action delay, so no actions will be automatically applied to threads after they are posted.

helptopic.title: Unstick Sticky Thread After Delay
helptopic.text: Select this option to have threads posted by this RSS feed unstuck after the delay specified by 'Thread Action Delay'.

helptopic.title: Close Thread After Delay
helptopic.text: Select this option to have threads posted by this RSS feed automatically close after the delay specified in 'Thread Action Delay'.

helptopic.title: Allow HTML in Announcements
helptopic.text:
If you enable this option, any HTML in RSS feed items will be allowed as HTML in announcements posted by the feed.

Do not enable this option unless you trust the RSS feed source completely, as your board could be hacked if the RSS feed source contains malicious HTML.

helptopic.title: Days for Announcement to Remain Active
helptopic.text: Announcements posted by this RSS feed will become inactive and disappear from public view after this number of days.

helptopic.title: Group Icon Path
helptopic.text: This is the icon path to the group icons when they are stored on the filesystem. This should not be changed unless you know what you are doing.

helptopic.title: Group Icon URL
helptopic.text: This is the URL to the group icons when they are stored in the filesystem. This should not be changed unless you know what you are doing.

helptopic.title: Description
helptopic.text: This is a friendly description of the category.

helptopic.title: Display Order
helptopic.text: This determines where the category is displayed in option lists.

helptopic.title: Title
helptopic.text: This is the title of the Group Category. This will be displayed in the breadcrumb when viewing a group or filtering by categories. It will also be displayed in the category cloud in the Group overview page.

helptopic.title: Category
helptopic.text: Search for groups within the specified category.

helptopic.title: Group Created By
helptopic.text: Search for groups created by this username

helptopic.title: Creation Date is After
helptopic.text: Search for groups created after this date.

helptopic.title: Creation Date is Before
helptopic.text: Search for groups created before this date.

helptopic.title: Keyword(s)
helptopic.text: Words to search for within the group (This searches title and description)

helptopic.title: Members Greater Than
helptopic.text: Search for groups with more than this amount of Members.

helptopic.title: Members Less Than
helptopic.text: Search for groups with less than this amount of Members.

helptopic.title: Group Type
helptopic.text: Search for groups of this type.

helptopic.title: About Statistics
helptopic.text:
Related General Help Topics:
Statistics
Control Panel Log
Moderator Log
Scheduled Task Log

Statistics:
vBulletin's statistics page contains various stats for your forums. The stats on this page include "top" stats (newest member, top poster, most users online, etc) and various forum activity stats.

You can run reports for a specific stat over a specific time period to view patterns of activity on your forums. Patterns of forum activity can be used for many different things. For example, if you run an advertising campaign for your site and want to check its effectiveness in terms of new forum registrations then you can run reports showing new registrations from before and during the campaign.

helptopic.title: Statistics
helptopic.text:
The [Top Statistics] link will show you the following statistics: the newest registered member, the most users online at one time, the user with the highest post count, the most replied to thread, the most viewed thread, and the most popular forum.

The [Registration Statistics], [User Activity Statistics], [New Thread Statistics], and [New Post Statistics] links will take you to a page where you can run a report by date showing corresponding statistic on a daily, weekly, or monthly basis.

helptopic.title: Statistics Report
helptopic.text: On this page you can run a report on the selected statistic. Select a date range, unit of time (scope), and an order for the report. When you are done selecting from the options you can click the "Go" button to run the report. Please see the individual help topics below if you have questions about an option.

helptopic.title: Start Date
helptopic.text: Select a start date for this report. Select a month, day, and year. The selected statistic must be no older than this date for it to be included in the report.

helptopic.title: End Date
helptopic.text: Select an end date for this report. Select a month, day, and year. The selected statistic must not be newer than this date for it to be included in the report. You can use this setting in conjunction with the "Start Date" setting to create a window of time for this report.

helptopic.title: Scope
helptopic.text: Select the unit of time by which you want the report to group the statistics. If you select "Daily" then the report will tell you the number per day, etc.

helptopic.title: Order By Date
helptopic.text: "Ascending" order will put the oldest dates at the top of the report and the newest dates at the bottom... the dates "ascend" as you get further into the report. "Descending" is just the opposite.

helptopic.title: Empty Results
helptopic.text: Any days, weeks, or months that have no results will not be shown if this option is set to "No".

helptopic.title: Top Statistics
helptopic.text: Below is a list of trivial statistics for your forums. You can click on the individual links in the statistics to view the corresponding user, thread, or forum.

helptopic.title: About Subscription Permissions
helptopic.text:
Related General Help Topics:
Subscriptions
Subscription Permissions

Subscription Permissions:
By default, users will have the permission to purchase any of your available subscriptions (see the Subscription Manager). However, you might not want users of a particular usergroup to have access to purchase a subscription. In that case, vBulletin allows you to deny any subscription for any usergroup. The user must not have the denied usergroup as their primary usergroup or as one of their secondary groups.

helptopic.title: Editing Subscription Permissions
helptopic.text: On this screen you set up allow or deny access for the specific subscription and usergroup. Options are described below.

helptopic.title: Can Use Subscription
helptopic.text: By default users will be allowed access to purchase any subscription. If this option is set to No then this usergroup will be denied access to purchase this subscription. Please be aware that a user can have a primary and secondary groups. If permission is allowed for one of the user's secondary groups then they will be able to purchase the donation, even if their primary usergroup does not have permission.

helptopic.title: Modifying Subscription Permissions
helptopic.text: From here you can deny access for any usergroup for a specific subscription. For each subscription you have, each usergroup is listed. If the name of the group is red, they are denied access to purchase the subscription. If the name is black, they have permission to purchase the subscription. To change permissions, click Edit next to the group name you wish to change, under the subscription you wish it to apply to.

helptopic.title: About Subscriptions
helptopic.text:
Subscriptions:
vBulletin's subscription manager is used to charge users for forum access. Make sure you enable at least one payment method within the Payment API Manager if you use paid subscriptions.

Subscriptions manage forum access by adding and removing primary and secondary group memberships as well as manipulating user access masks. For an explanation about usergroups and forum permissions see the general help topic for Usergroups.

helptopic.title: Add New Subscription
helptopic.text:
This page allows you to add a new subscription. If you have any questions about the options below please see the individual help topics.

If you want this subscription to manipulate user access masks, make sure you have access masks enabled in your vBulletin options.

helptopic.title: Shortname
helptopic.text: This is a short name for the subscription and is only used internally. It may only contain letters, numerals and the underscore character and must start with a letter.

helptopic.title: Keep Custom Avatar
helptopic.text:
This option only applies if this subscription results in the user gaining permission to have custom avatars.
If the user selects a custom avatar, then they will be allowed to keep it after this subscription expires if their normal permissions do not allow for custom avatars.

helptopic.title: Keep Profile Pic
helptopic.text:
This option only applies if this subscription results in the user gaining permission to have a profile picture.
If the user selects a profile picture, then they will be allowed to keep it after this subscription expires if their normal permissions do not allow for profile pictures.

helptopic.title: Title
helptopic.text:
The subscription title is used to identify this subscription on the Paid Subscriptions page in the User CP and in the subscription manager in the Admin CP. The title should indicate what this subscription is for.

Use the Translations like to translate the title for your other languages.

helptopic.title: Description
helptopic.text: Enter a description for this subscription. The description should explain what the users get for buying this subscription. This description will show up on the Paid Subscriptions page in the User CP when users go to buy subscriptions.Use the Translations like to translate the description for your other languages.

helptopic.title: Active
helptopic.text: Check this box to make this subscription active so users will be able to purchase it. Active subscriptions are available for purchase on the Paid Subscriptions page in the User CP. If you want to remove a subscription but you think you might use it again in the future, you can uncheck this box to disable the subscription as opposed to deleting it.

helptopic.title: Subscription Length
helptopic.text: Enter a number in the text field and select a unit of time to create a subscription length.

helptopic.title: Cost in U.S. Dollars
helptopic.text:
Enter a cost for this subscription in U.S. dollars. Enter 0.00 if you don't want to accept payments in U.S. dollars for this subscription.

If you need to calculate the U.S. dollar equivalent of some other currency you can use this site.

helptopic.title: Cost in Pounds Sterling
helptopic.text:
Enter a cost for this subscription in pounds sterling. Enter 0.00 if you don't want to accept payments in pounds sterling for this subscription.

If you need to calculate the pounds sterling equivalent of some other currency you can use this site.

helptopic.title: Cost in Euros
helptopic.text:
Enter a cost for this subscription in euros. Enter 0.00 if you don't want to accept payments in euros for this subscription.

If you need to calculate the euro equivalent of some other currency you can use this site.

helptopic.title: Primary Usergroup
helptopic.text: If you want this subscription to change a user's primary group then select a target usergroup here. Select "No Change" if you don't want this subscription to change a user's primary group.

helptopic.title: Additional Usergroups
helptopic.text: If you want this subscription to add users to any secondary groups you can check them here. When a user purchases this subscription they will be added to these secondary groups.

helptopic.title: Sales Tax
helptopic.text:
The following only applies for PayPal payments, if you have enabled sales tax under the Selling Preferences of your PayPal account, and the buyer is located in an area that you tax.

By default, no sales tax will be added to payments. Check this box if you need sales tax added to payments.

helptopic.title: Shipping Address
helptopic.text:
This only applies to PayPal payments.

You can choose to have the buyer's shipping address be optional, required, or not specified.

helptopic.title: Display Order
